STBLKeyStringList.Text: {0.SimFirstName} has overcome {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} fear of Horses! {0.SimPronounSubjective} can engage once more with these magnificent creatures without a sense of terror.

{1.ObjectName} has run away due to inadequate care which led to her being Unhappy for quite a while. She may come back if {0.SimFirstName} can provide food, keep her clean, and give her ample attention. For now, {0.SimFirstName} will just have to wait for her to return.
{1.ObjectName} has returned after a grand adventure! Better treat her right this time or she might not come back again!
(From Being Around a Yelling Mini Goat)
(From Watching a Mini Sheep Perform a Trick)
(From Seeing Trusty Steed Rock at Sunrise)
(From Drinking Nectar as a Nectar Know-It-All)
(From Finding the Heart of Dreadhorse Caverns)

Suddenly, {0.SimFirstName} freezes as they are overcome with a vision. Or were these... memories? A room with no door. Eating blowfish over and over for some reason. And oddest of all, a strange glowing hexagonal bipyramid floating ominously overhead. As {0.SimFirstName} is released from the images, they look above them to see nothing. Was this a gnome-induced vision or memories of some sort of past life? {0.SimFirstName} may never know and continues to explore the cavern.
{0.SimFirstName} failed to appease the Gnome and is chased out of the cave!
{0.SimFirstName} kicks the Gnome in the shins. Its shriek of humiliation attracts the attention of the Gnome High Council which promptly ejects {0.SimFirstName} from the cave.
This is exactly what this Gnome wanted! A gnomish reward is given.\n\n+50 to Cave Progress

The Unicorn is not pleased with {0.SimFirstName}'s choice. The Unicorn lets out a disheartened whicker and walks away with a flash of light, blinding and transporting {0.SimFirstName} out of the cave.
{0.SimFirstName}'s ignorance has insulted the Unicorn. With a flash of light and an exasperated whinny, {0.SimFirstName} kicked out of the cave.
The Unicorn thinks {0.SimFirstName} has chosen wisely and bestows a gift.
{0.SimFirstName} has defeated the creature! It looks like it dropped some items!\n\n+25 to Cave Progress
The creature dealt critical damage to {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} is defeated and is chased out of the cave by the creature!
The creature gets distracted and abandons its pursuit. {0.SimFirstName} sighs in relief and continues to explore.\n\n+15 to Cave Progress
The T-Rex's chase drains {1.Number} stamina from {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName}'s quick movement drains {1.Number} stamina from the T-Rex!
{0.SimFirstName} tired the T-Rex out! Its big head and little arms made it too difficult to continue. It looks like it dropped some items!\n\n+25 to Cave Progress
{0.SimFirstName} flees and is chased out of the cave by the T-Rex!
The T-Rex loses interest in the shiny object. {0.SimFirstName} sighs in relief and continues to explore.\n\n+15 to Cave Progress
The Flaming Skull's intense heat dealt {1.Number} damage to {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} used the power of Nectar and defeated the Flaming Skull of Necteaux! It looks like it dropped some items!\n\n+50 to Cave Progress
The Flaming Skull's heat has dealt a critical blow to {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} flees and is chased out of the cave by The Flaming Skull of Necteaux!
The Flaming Skull gets distracted and abandons its pursuit. {0.SimFirstName} sighs in relief and continues to explore.\n\n+15 to Cave Progress
{0.SimFirstName} has defeated the Gnome-Rog! It looks like it dropped some items!\n\n+50 to Cave Progress
The Gnome-Rog dealt a critical blow to {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} is chased out of the cave by the Gnome-Rog!
The Gnome-Rog gets distracted and abandons its pursuit. {0.SimFirstName} sighs in relief and continues to explore.\n\n+15 to Cave Progress
The Headless Rider dealt {1.Number} damage to {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} defeated the Headless Rider! It looks like it dropped some items!\n\n+50 to Cave Progress
The Headless Rider dealt critical damage to {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} is chased out of the cave by The Headless Rider!
The Headless Rider gets distracted and abandons their pursuit. {0.SimFirstName} sighs in relief and continues to explore.\n\n+15 to Cave Progress
{0.SimFirstName} has lost {1.Number} Simoleons to the Mysterious Challenger!
{0.SimFirstName} has won {1.Number} Simoleons from the Mysterious Challenger!

{0.SimFirstName} has been crowned the thumb war champion and defeated The Mysterious Challenger! As {0.SimFirstName} counts {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} earnings, the stranger slips away to never be heard from again.\n\n+50 to Cave Progress
The Mysterious Challenger dealt a critical blow to {0.SimFirstName}'s finances! With that, {0.SimFirstName} runs out of the cave to figure out where to get more Simoleons!
{0.SimFirstName} flees for {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} finances and is chased out of the cave by the Mysterious Challenger!
{0.SimFirstName} found {1.Number} Simoleons on the ground during a thumb stretch.
The Mysterious Challenger accidentally drops a briefcase of Simoleons and loses it all to the cave winds. {0.SimFirstName} sighs in relief and continues to explore.\n\n+15 to Cave Progress
{0.SimFirstName} tried to extract the ore gently, but has triggered a cave-in. Luckily, {0.SimPronounSubjective} made it out before being squished underneath the rocks.
{0.SimFirstName} ignores the ore and continues to explore the cave.
{0.SimFirstName} successfully extracted the ore and discovered something beneath the rubble.
{0.SimFirstName} tries to open the door but triggers a trap and barely escapes! How can the door be opened? There must be a clue.
The door gleams with mystery, but {0.SimFirstName} walks swiftly past it. With no more areas in the cave to explore, {0.SimFirstName} must exit.

{0.SimFirstName} brings the Mini Sheep to the door and urges it forward. The Mini Sheep makes a resounding "baaa" sound, and the door suddenly starts to open, revealing a new underground level to the cave.\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has successfully unlocked level {1.Number} of the cave!
The Goose is not amused. {0.SimFirstName} needs to find something geese like to eat. What could it be?
{0.SimFirstName}'s goose isn't cooked yet and decides to leave the cave to figure out what will tempt the impeding fowl.
The Goose happily eats the Prairie Grass offering and moves off the bridge.\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has successfully unlocked level {1.Number} of the cave!
{0.SimFirstName} tries to put out the fire, but does not succeed. What could possibly quench this fire's thirst!
With nothing to defeat the flames, {0.SimFirstName} leaves the cave to think of how to surpass this obstacle.
No inferno can match the might of a glass of water! {0.SimFirstName} douses the flame and continues exploring the cave.\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has successfully unlocked level {1.Number} of the cave!
The ghost angerly chases {0.SimFirstName} out of the cave. What Nectar could a spirit possibly want?
The ghost seems haunting enough that {0.SimFirstName} is not willing to engage just yet. With no cave areas left to explore, {0.SimPronounSubjective} leaves to think on what the spirit could want.

{0.SimFirstName} makes an offering of Potato Nectar which the ghost accepts! The path is unblocked and {0.SimFirstName} continues adventuring.\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has successfully unlocked level {1.Number} of the cave!
{0.SimFirstName} makes an offering but the Frog King still seems blue. What can {0.SimFirstName} bring? Maybe some frog friends?
With the frog blocking the only way forward, {0.SimFirstName} is forced to exit the cave with the hope {0.SimPronounSubjective} can find a way through.

{0.SimFirstName} puts down the 3 Yellow Frogs. The Frog King smiles warmly. {0.SimFirstName} keeps exploring as the frogs hop away happily.\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has successfully unlocked level {1.Number} of the cave!
The Swamp Creature sees the offering but remains unmoved. Only those who can solve the riddle may progress.
The Swamp Creature has proven to be a bit scary to {0.SimFirstName}. Maybe returning at another time will allow {0.SimPronounSubjective} explore further.

"Ah yes... exactly what I needed!" {0.SimFirstName} releases the Rainbow Fish into the lake and the Swamp Creature swims away revealing the entrance. The adventure continues.\n\n{0.SimFirstName} has successfully unlocked level {1.Number} of the cave!

{0.SimFirstName} lifts the lid of the chest gingerly but is shocked as a snake pops out to {0.SimFirstName}'s hand. The sneaky snake chases {0.SimFirstName} out of the cave! Why does it always have to be snakes?!
The treasure chest remains untouched as {0.SimFirstName} decides to ignore it and explore more of the cave. Who knows if that treasure chest is actually a treasure chest and isn't just mimicking one!
{0.SimFirstName} opens the lid carefully and is pleased to discover it contains treasure!
Uh Oh! Despite {0.SimFirstName}'s best efforts, things aren't going well with Horses. A few more bad interactions and a Fear may develop.

After talking it out, {0.SimFirstName} feels more confident about interacting with Horses. More time is needed to confront the Fear, but {0.SimFirstName} feels {0.SimPronounSubjective} can approach a Horse again.
Oh no! {0.SimFirstName} is terrified of horses! {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} will not have the will to interact with one until {0.SimPronounSubjective} Confronts the Fear.

{0.SimFirstName} is Fatigued! When Horses exercise and train continuously, they will eventually become Fatigued and need rest and water. Consider buying a Water Trough so Horses will have a supply of refreshing water to drink!\n\n⚒ Water Trough
{0.SimFirstName}'s dedication to Rancher life pays off again. {0.SimPronounSubjective} knew just how to stomp and extracted an extra bottle's worth of Nectar from this batch!
{0.SimFirstName} is bursting... with anticipation to meet her Foal!

Hey there! I'm your Ranch Hand. The name is {0.SimLastName}. Nice to meet y'all! I'm good with animals, plants, and repairs. Let me know and I'll handle it! This Ranch is going to run like a well-oiled machine. Oh, and if you want me to harvest plants or pick up Manure, just ask. Otherwise, I'll leave it to you. I want to make sure that's what you'd want. You never know!
(From Seeing the Death of a Beloved Mini Goat)
(From Seeing the Death of a Beloved Mini Sheep)

Mini Goats and Mini Sheep are adorable, uplifting, and useful friends to add to your ranch. Mini Goats can be milked for Simoleons and Mini Sheep can be sheared for Simoleons. Both are helpful in the garden. Purchase them through the Phone, Animal Feeders, Community Boards, and Bits & Bales Mercantile in New Appaloosa.

The Equestrian Center is the perfect place for all Horse lovers. Sims can rescue, sell, and train their Horses here. Sims also can spectate competitions for a fun pastime. Horses and their riders can compete in Barrel Racing, Jumping, Endurance Racing, and Western Pleasure competitions. The top-tier competitors can try for the Ultimate Horse Championship!

Horse Care means you get to bond with your Horse while taking care of Horses basic needs. Brushing a Horse's coat or picking hooves keeps the horse clean.\nCare is especially special for a new foal on the Ranch, where you can make sure the Foals feeding needs are met by Bottle Feeding and Training the Foals to Eat Hay.
{0.SimFirstName} is back from training. They've increased their skill.
{0.SimFirstName} has finished giving Riding Lessons, which improved {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Horse Riding Skill and {1.SimFirstName}'s Temperament Skill.\n\nEarned {3.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} completed the Mini-Goat work and has earned some money.\nEarned {2.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} has finished a guided trail ride, which improved {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Horse Riding Skill and {1.SimFirstName}'s Endurance Skill.\n\nEarned {3.Money}

{0.SimFirstName} finished hauling {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} neighbor's cargo. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} earned some money and improved {1.SimFirstName}'s Endurance skill.\n\nEarned {3.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} finished the Mini Sheep-for-Hire work and has earned some money.\n\nEarned {2.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} has started a Mini Goat-for-Hire Job.
{0.SimFirstName} has started a guided trail ride.
{0.SimFirstName} has started a Mini Sheep-for-Hire Job.
{0.SimFirstName} has started training a neighbor's horse.
{0.SimFirstName} has finished teaching Barrel Racing, which improved {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Horse Riding Skill and {1.SimFirstName}'s Agility Skill.\nEarned {3.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} finished teaching Endurance Racing, which improved {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Horse Riding Skill and {1.SimFirstName}'s Endurance Skill.\nEarned {3.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} finished teaching Show Jumping, which increased {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Horse Riding Skill and {1.SimFirstName}'s Jumping Skill.\nEarned {3.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} finished teaching Western Pleasure which improved {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Horse Riding Skill and {1.SimFirstName}'s Temperament Skill.\nEarned {3.Money}
{0.SimFirstName} finished training a neighbor's horse, which improved {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Horse Riding Skill.\n\nEarned {2.Money}

All the top Ranchers know, the bigger the Ranch the harder it is to run all by yourself. Why not hire a Ranch Hand? A good Ranch Hand is around from morning to evening and helps out with Livestock care, general repairs, and gardening. If asked, they'll even help bring in the harvest! Any productive, well-oiled machine-of-a-Ranch is going to want one.

Folks love to get together for any sort of shindig. Pull up a barrel and host a Ranch Gathering. The best ones have Ranch Music, Cowpoke Dancing, Nectar, grilling, and all the neighborly socializing a Sim could ask for.\n\nIf animals are more your speed, put together a Ranch Animal Day. The community is always more than happy to play with and care for adorable, fluffy animals. Who wouldn't be?

Looking for the lowdown on all the best Ranching and Nectar-Making tips? These two Sims are the ones to ask! These residents will be a valuable resource in all aspects of your Chestnut Ridge lifestyle!
The Horse Trainer can be found near the Equestrian Center. This Sim can help improve your horse's abilities and provide helpful ranching tips.

As wise as he is mysterious, Roberto Crinkletop is an expert in ranching and nectar making. Find him around Bits & Bales Mercantile in New Appaloosa Monday, Wednesday, and Friday for a few hours around high noon.
Howdy there! Friendly reminder that the Hay Now! Equestrian Center is open from 7 AM to 7 PM! If we're closed, just come back tomorrow for an exciting day of training and competition!
Howdy there! Swing by the Hay Now! Equestrian Center for the best training in town and test your horsemanship in our competitions! We're open from 7 AM to 7 PM every day.
That's all the Nectar for today, folks! Hope to see you again soon!
If you're looking to sell your homemade Nectar, I'd be happy to purchase it for above face value due to the current high demand!
Being a Brave horse, {0.SimFirstName} was able to comfort {1.SimFirstName} to no longer be Spooked!
{0.SimFirstName} has entered a Barrel Racing competition
{0.SimFirstName} has entered an Endurance Racing Competition.
{0.SimFirstName} has entered a Show Jumping Competition.
{0.SimFirstName} has entered an Ultimate Horse Championship.
{0.SimFirstName} has entered a Western Pleasure Competition.

Ah, yes. You're putting the pieces together. Well, you've earned my trust. The next time you're crafting some nectar try using Death Flower and Spinach, an old family recipe that's quite good for your longevity. Even post-life, as a matter of fact... I have a spare bottle if you'd like to give it a spin, but in the future you'll have to prepare it yourself. I may even have ingredients I can part with from time-to-time.
Why of course, you caught me just after a Death Flower harvest. Please have one.
Ingredients? Let me see, let me see, this spinach is all I appear to have right now. But it's yours!
{1.SimFirstName} thinks Agility is easier with four feet, so it's a pity {0.SimFirstName} only has two of them....
{1.SimFirstName} thinks the key to increasing Fitness Skill is simple... Have some fun! What a Playful Horsie.
{1.SimFirstName} thinks the key to increasing Fitness Skill is consistent training. Also praise. {1.SimFirstName} honestly just loves praise.
{1.SimFirstName} thinks the key to increasing Fitness Skill is being filled with rage! Then again, maybe {1.SimFirstName} is just a silly, Aggressive Horse.
{1.SimFirstName} advises to press A to jump, whatever that means.
{1.SimFirstName} is an Intelligent Horse and therefore {1.SimPronounSubjective} doubts the physics of double jumping.
{1.SimFirstName} thinks patience and compassion will help connecting with other Sims, just like with Horses!
Maybe it's because of who {1.SimPronounSubjective} is as a Horse, but {1.SimFirstName} thinks being assertive always is a good way to deal with others.
{1.SimFirstName} has a good muzzle to cry on. {0.SimFirstName} feels better now.
{1.SimFirstName} is delighted to be complimented. Do it again. Please?
{1.SimFirstName} seems bashful, but proud, with such a compliment!
{1.SimFirstName} is happy to be appreciated. Who wouldn't be?
{1.SimFirstName} advises to take a deep breath and think of Hay. Yep. Always works.
{1.SimFirstName} can feel {0.SimFirstName}'s passion and resolves to give it {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} all when training!

{1.SimFirstName} tries to explain the secret formula for the perfect Barrel Run design. As Intelligent as {1.SimFirstName} is the design is brilliant, but unfortunately, {0.SimFirstName} doesn't actually speak horse...
{1.SimFirstName} likes Barrel Runs that go around and around and around and...
{1.SimFirstName} wonders if Barrel Runs are just a way to control where we go. What a Free Spirit!
{1.SimFirstName} thinks any ride with {1.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} favorite Sim makes for a terrific ride!
{1.SimFirstName} suggests that any Free Spirit Horse loves rides on big, open plains. Obviously.
{1.SimFirstName} enjoys jumps that go up then down, not the ones that go down then up. Avoid those.
{1.SimFirstName} gave {0.SimFirstName} some very helpful pointers! Obviously, most of them benefited {1.SimFirstName}, but who can blame such a cute Horse?

{0.SimFirstName} is a Horse Lover. Horse Lovers enjoy socializing with Horses and are empathetic to Horse emotions. Because of this deep connection, they may get sad when they have not interacted with Horses for a while.

{0.SimFirstName} is a Rancher at heart. {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent|xxUpper} idea of a good time includes doing chores around the ranch and interacting with Livestock. Rancher Sims excel at ranch life, occasionally making a bonus bottle when crafting Nectar or extra Hay when harvesting Prairie Grass. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} will be more successful at Horse Breeding.

It wasn't easy. {0.SimFirstName} had to spend a lot of time and commitment with Horses and {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} own Horse Riding Skill. There were numerous victories and disappointments along the way, but, finally, {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} dream of becoming a Championship Rider is real! Trait Earned: Grand Champ Trainer These Sims train Horse Skills faster, sell Horses for higher prices, inspire confidence in themselves and their Horse when riding and training, and almost always have a good time when riding. In fact, they are so good with Horses that Horses have even more fun when being ridden by them. They also can Give Competition Advice to aspiring riders.
This Sim wants to be one of the world's premiere Horse Riders and will prove it by participating in Horse Competitions.

Nectar Making is truly an art and {0.SimFirstName} has mastered it. Those who drink the delectable Nectar produced by {0.SimPronounObjective} instantly know that it was crafted by an Expert Nectar Maker, a Sim who has arduously perfected their craft. {0.SimFirstName} should take pride in that. Trait Earned: Nectar Know-It-All These Sims can craft pre-aged Nectar, have an iron bladder when it comes to drinking Nectar, and their negative emotions have less influence on their current mood.
This Sim wants to master the art of Nectar Making, honing their abilities to consistently craft only the best Nectars. They also want to make an absurd amount of Simoleons doing it.
Hello. If you see me, please report me to a Producer.
This will boost the speed at which your Sim gains Horse Riding Skill while in a Club Gathering.
Maybe Mini Goats don't like knock-knock jokes.
You Have Goat to Be Kidding Me
That joke couldn't even crack a mini smile on the Mini Sheep.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling hyped after that quick nap!
Mini Goats are surprisingly good huggers.
The true champ is one that can pet a Mini Goat without getting headbutted.
Once they stop yelling, Mini Goats are great conversationalists.
Nothing like the feeling of pure fluffiness!
The Mini Sheep was a bit sheepish at first but warmed up to the friendly gesture.
Have you any good stories to tell?
That Mini Goat really got into {0.SimFirstName}'s head.
This Mini Goat is quite the silly billy.
It's pretty fun kidding around with a furry friend.
That Mini Goat doesn't look very pleased.
No fluffs about it. That was pretty mean!
A Wolf Among the Mini Sheep
Getting the Mini Sheep to laugh was a fleece of cake.
Who can be sad when you're playing with something so cute?
The poor Mini Sheep was just trying to graze peacefully.
{0.SimFirstName} can't believe a Mini Sheep could do that!
It's never easy losing a little furry friend.
That Mini Goat was just here! Where did they go? Did {0.SimFirstName} make them mad?
That grumpy Mini Goat had nothing nice to say.
The Mini Goat wasn't interested in playing childish games.
The loss of a dear Mini Sheep is almost too much to bear.
So fluffy but definitely not interested in being hugged.
That Mini Sheep was just here! Where did they go? Did {0.SimFirstName} make them mad?
The Mini Sheep just wanted some personal space.
The Mini Sheep had places to go and people to see and had no time to play.
No need to count Mini Sheep when the conversation's that boring.
That's going to leave a pretty big bruise.
{0.SimFirstName}'s ears won't stop ringing from all the yelling!
Yee haw! That dance got the plasma flowing like a waterhole in the rainy season!
The death of a familiar Horse is a sad occasion. Sims can mourn at a tombstone to feel more at peace.
The gnomish vision has sparked a question: is this world just a simulation?
{0.SimFirstName} braved the Dreadhorse Caverns and lived to tell the tale!
Being near the Unknown Horse's grave... in the dark... in the middle of nowhere... it's just a bit too much for {0.SimFirstName}!
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling inspired to bond with {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} animals after some ranch-spiration!
After receiving nectar-making wisdom, {0.SimFirstName} is eager to stomp some fruit!
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling revitalized and ready for some ranch chores after speaking with an experienced rancher!
The Horse Trainer provided some good riding tips, time to put them to the test!
The early morning light hit just right. {0.SimFirstName} is awed by the beauty of {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} surroundings!
Nothing is more exciting than watching a competition at the Hay Now! Equestrian Center!
{0.SimFirstName} is too terrified to Hand Feed. Better make sure an Animal Feeder is stocked so the Horse can eat.
{0.SimFirstName} is too terrified to clean a Horse right now. Use another Sim or hire a Ranch Hand.
After discussing Horses with someone close, you don't feel so terrified after all.
{0.SimFirstName} is way too terrified to interact with Horses.
Ghostly neighing from beyond the veil sends a chill galloping down {0.SimFirstName}'s spine.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling a bit riled up right now. Perhaps asking a Defiant Horse to cooperate wasn't the best move! Attempting to calm the Horse is possible -- just proceed with caution!
There is so much to learn from an expert Horse Trainer!
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#6fd5ff'>Confident</font> after going for an amazing ride!\n\nConfident Horses will perform better in Competitions at the Equestrian Center!
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#6fd5ff'>Confident</font> after a successful training session.\n\nConfident Horses will perform better in competitions at the Equestrian Center!
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#6fd5ff'>Confident</font> from the words of encouragement.\n\nA little encouragement and kindness go a long way!

{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#6fd5ff'>Confident</font> from time spent training and learning from a Grand Champ Trainer!\n\nConfident Horses will perform better in Competitions at the Equestrian Center!

{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#6fd5ff'>Confident</font> after an exhilarating ride with a Grand Champ Trainer!\n\nConfident Horses will perform better in competitions at the Equestrian Center!

{0.SimFirstName} is Dazed after intense training.\n\nHorses with the MellowTrait can become overwhelmed from too much training. Training while dazed is difficult, so {0.SimPronounSubjective} should take a break for a bit.

{0.SimFirstName} was just born and is feeling <font color='#da99ff'>Dazed</font>. What are all these colors, sounds, and four wobbly noodles? With time, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will find {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} footing.
{0.SimFirstName} is <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> that all {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} needs are met!
{0.SimFirstName} enjoyed being cradled and is feeling <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font>.\n\nFoals need lots of love and attention, so keep it up! Physical contact builds foals' Temperament Skill.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling Happy after enjoying an excellent Treat.\n\nThe higher the quality of the Treat, the longer the happiness will last.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling Happy after enjoying a magnificent Treat.\n\nThe higher the quality of the Treat, the longer the happiness will last.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling Happy after enjoying a nice quality treat.\n\nThe higher the quality of the Treat, the longer the happiness will last.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling Happy after enjoying a perfect Treat.\n\nThe higher the quality of the Treat, the longer the happiness will last.
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> and exhilarated after getting exercise.\n\nHorses with the Energetic Trait love going for rides and running around!
{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> after going for a pleasant ride.\n\nGetting outside and going for a long ride will improve anyone's mood!

{0.SimFirstName} is <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> from the gentle touches {0.SimPronounSubjective} received.\n\nSmall acts of kindness like this go a long way in improving Temperament Skill and fostering a strong, lasting relationship!
{0.SimFirstName} is <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> after a positive encounter with a Mini Goat.\n\nPerhaps they were comparing the flavor profiles of Prairie Grass Hay!
{0.SimFirstName} is <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> after hanging out with a Mini Sheep.\n\nThese fluffy bundles of joy can bring happiness to any household!
{0.SimFirstName} is <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> to have had some delicious Hay.\n\nFoals need to get used to eating Hay. {0.SimFirstName} is well on {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} way.

{0.SimFirstName} is <font color='#9aff00'>Happy</font> from exploring {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} surroundings.\n\nFoals are experiencing the sights and sounds of the world around them for the first time and it's all so exciting!

{0.SimFirstName} is <font color='#8eb3ff'>Sad</font> because {0.SimPronounSubjective} failed {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} training.\n\nTraining can be tough, but it will pay off! If at first you don't succeed, try and try again!

{0.SimFirstName} is feeling <font color='#8eb3ff'>Sad</font> after a tough competition loss at the Equestrian Center.\n\nTo improve the chance of winning, {0.SimPronounSubjective} should keep training {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} Skills. Competing in the right Mood will help, too! Also, a Horse with Confidence will perform better than an Uncomfortable or Sad horse.
{0.SimFirstName} is a Needy Horse and is feeling Sad because {0.SimPronounSubjective} prefers to be hand-fed.\n\nSome harvested Prairie Grass Hay or a tasty Apple helps in these situations!

Give your home all the rustic charm of a log cabin with the best timber that can be found.

It may not be fancy, but this spandrel doesn't need to be. Ranch life is all about functionality. It might look like plain wood, but it does exactly what it needs to. Sometimes, it's about function over form and that's what this spandrel is made for.
This round log column uplifts with simple, natural beauty. It brings a certain honesty and wholesomeness to its work, supporting that above it with quiet intensity.

If this wood was good enough to use for home, there's no reason it can't also be used for fencing. Some people really want everything in their home to match. Keep everyone in or keep everyone out with some lovely, rustic fencing.
Because your porch and/or property line needs to have the same feel as the rest of your ranch and/or home.

This practical board fence is here for you. Put it where it needs to go and it'll stand up to anything and everything. Livestock and Horses in, unwanted visitors out. Your fence will stand firm against it all.
Talk about stability—this stall here is made from the most sturdy wood to build the finest of stalls for a horse stable.

Everyone knows that a home is only as good as its foundation. Ranch homes are built to last, and this foundation will make sure it happens. Using tightly stacked stones that won't move in the fact of anything, rest assured this foundation is as sturdy as they come.

The Animal Feeder can serve as your one-stop shop to satisfy the hunger of all your ranch animals. Horse, Mini Goats, and Mini Sheep can all be directed to eat at this object or even do it on their own accord.
Mini Goats can be milked once a day.
Mini Sheep can be sheared once a day.

It's one big ball! Your Horses are going to love having a toy their size to play with.

For all the improvements that's been made over the years, there's still a few pieces of the old town charm. That includes the production of a bar that's an exact replica of the very first one ever built in the area. If you look closely, it's got all the same stains and maybe a name or two carved into it if you know where to find them.

This type of shed originally held harvested Prairie Grass Hay on one side and mounds of manure on the other side. Today, it has shifted from Horse poo to Sim doo doo as a public bathroom where occupants can race to relieve themselves the fastest.

The Equestrian Center goes through a ton of barrels. At one point, there had been a really good wholesale deal, leaving them with, frankly, too many barrels. They've since been repurposed into lots of things, including this bathtub. Don't worry, it was sanded down first.
This bunk bed is what you would call having good and sturdy bones. Combine with a single bed so friends can stick together. Also compatible with desks and more.

We're not too sure where the wood was repurposed from, but we promise it's supreme quality for all your sleepin' needs. There used to be more buildings downtown, so we would not be surprised if it was reclaimed from what was left.

After spending a long day of working with animals, making nectar, and keeping the house in order, a rancher needs their rest! This bed was made for those people who really need a good night's sleep so they can get up and do all their work again tomorrow.
A comfortable place for horses to rest and regain energy. Instruct a horse where to sleep by assigning them to a bed in Live Mode.

We're not too sure where the wood was repurposed from, but we promise its supreme quality for all your sleepin' needs. Once you grow out of this size, there is a matching double bed for lifelong use. The wood will last, guaranteed.

Don't have the space or need for a double bed? The Rancher's Rest comes in a single! It offers all the same support to those busy ranchers and only takes up half the space. Best to save space for animals and nectar.
Follow the road and cross the border into dreamland with all the pretty Horses, free of the day's superfluous punctuation.
This sleeping bag is the perfect way for your lil' rancher Toddler to drift asleep counting Mini Sheep under the big, open night sky.

Want to sleep a night or two under the stars? Experience the night like your ranch animals do? This sleeping bag gives you just enough that you're not sleeping directly on the ground. Can't be much closer to nature if you wanted to.
Under the Stars Bedroll Sleeping Bag

Ranch homes used to be an exclusively cast iron cookware kind of place. While modern kitchens use all sorts of pots and pans, the Range Rustic line was constructed to hold the heaviest cast iron. Everything else is guaranteed to fit perfectly, and there won't be a single cabinet falling any time soon.

Those Nectar people keep calling this a "rustic fire pit" because "campfire" is apparently too plain for them. Either way, it offers light, warmth, and that smell of burning wood everyone's come to expect no matter what it's called.

Adding a chimney like this to any home will likely spark comments like "Wow, that's one rustic chimney!" In this case, that's a good thing. It feels homey, not broken... except maybe for that one stone that's missing, but no one can even see it from here.

The Rustic Range line was designed with both form and functionality in mind. The kitchen island isn't there to fill space, it's there to do a job and it will! It's sturdy, has all the storage you need, and even has rounded drawers for your corners if that's what you need. What more could you ask for?

Feel at home with the Range Rustic Counter! Guaranteed to fit with the rest of your ranch home and to stand up to anything you can cook. The Range Rustic line was built to handle everything. No meal is too big, too small, or too messy for these counters.

Just because they're curtains doesn't mean they can't have some flare! These curtains come with fringe, offering much needed character to the walls and windows of any home. They were probably the most boring part of it anyway before the curtains came on the scene.

If there's the space for it, this wardrobe is well worth it. The doors might squeak the tiniest amount, but it's not breaking any time soon. It was built to last, and last it has. It'll probably outlive the person whose clothes are inside it, honestly.
Concealed in this unassuming glass is Nectar with a bright and bold entrance, balanced profile, and buttery mouthfeel. This inspiring classic goes down smooth and doesn't overstay its welcome.

The profile of sweet, tart, bitter, and earthen berry flavors in this Nectar perfectly reflects the creative journey of its creator: a mix of good, bad, all that life has to offer... and in the end, it all worked out.
Originally an attempt at homemade Power-Sip, this Nectar recipe's simple ingredients produce an electrifying, energetic flavor. This drink is all class, no sleep.
Gaining mastery of Nectar crafting isn't easy, but it does open room for creativity. This fruity concoction always contains a measure of happiness for any Sim who enjoys it.
This "beverage", if it can even be called that, is not so much a culinary invention as a bizarre alchemical joke: the overwhelming crush of death itself, flipped upside down by the humble spinach.

A gorgeous and understated Nectar. Vampires possessed of the most sophisticated tastes will find this drink is all sweetness, no bite. Non-vampires who drink this will feel sick, even the fancy ones. There, now you know.
Everyone thought Potato Nectar was madness. They said it wouldn't work. They were wrong. In fact, the resulting Nectar is quite drinkable, though its effects are strong. Drink responsibly!
Sweet strawberry flavors tumble across the palate, frolicking together and igniting the senses. Fall in love with this Nectar, and maybe also the consenting individual next to you!

Uncommon Nectar demands uncommon ingredients. Likewise, this Nectar is a taste to be acquired, not simply taken in-hand like any ordinary, pedestrian beverage. Side effects may include bodily odor and affinity with certain animals.
Valerian Nectar won't win any taste awards, but keen Spellcasters will be more interested in the contents: distilled essence of the Valerian Root.

Even the most easygoing Werewolf needs a break from Moonpetal Punch. Moonpetal Nectar offers a delicious alternative! Beware: any Werewolf who drinks too much will surely struggle to maintain control...
Who wouldn't enjoy a snack, a sip of Nectar, and a good cleanse at the same time? A tasty glass of Prairie Grass is the perfect pick-me-up for Sims who are as fancy as they are busy.
The original Nectar. This drink is the belle of any ball, dinner party, or midnight snack. Any Sim who enjoys this beverage will know, deep down, that fancy is a state of mind.

Gather yourself, your friends, and your family for a grill out on the Ranch. Why not just go ahead and invite the neighborhood for good times around the grill? This grill is designed to bring folks together for a good meal.

Use that extra wood lying around to keep warm! This fireplace is one of the best things ever made out of iron. It'll keep your ranch house warm on those chilly nights (and days, for that matter) and it looks like it was meant to be wherever you put it.
Despite popular belief, it does get cold out on the ranch from time to time. This fireplace will provide all the warmth you need on those chilly days and nights, and it'll look good doing it.

A great Ranch needs a great and dependable stall door with the best stability. Modern iron matched with natural unfinished wood completes the elegant and rustic charm especially fit for Sims and Horses with great taste.
What good is a paddock if you can't get in and out? Presenting the Paddock Gate: The best finishing touch to your Paddock Fencing for maximum (or any) accessibility.
A perfect match for your Timber! Log Fencing, this gate is sure to meet expectations, especially if your expectations involve it being log-shaped and also a gate.
Wood is fine for some, but, for others, metal is where it's at! This galvanized steel gate provides durability to the max. You could even say it's totally tubular.

Sell your fertilizer for a hefty profit or grow a thriving garden by fertilizing your plants with the best manure on the market. Ultimately don't let your horse waste its precious gift, instead use it to make your Ranch thrive!

The jump is too high to cross? Balderdash! With training, your Horse will be flying through the air lickitysplit!

Nothin' fancy is needed for home on the Ranch! Your Horse will enjoy this jumping obstacle just as much as any ol' fancy schmancy design. It gets the job done and soon your Horse will be a jumping virtuoso!

This Community Board provides valuable information on the local residents and all things ranch related. You can purchase animals, learn about animal care, or sign up your horse for training. You can also hire a Ranch Hand, plan a Ranch Event, and even do some community jobs to help around town!

This model affords maximum headroom.

Campfire stories have you scared of the dark? Or missing that soft campfire glow? This table lamp is sure to illuminate the room just right while keeping a classy rustic look.
This homemade candle with palo santo and sage brings a soft light to your space.
Whether you need to light up a barn, a hallway, or a bedroom, this Lone Star Lantern will drop kick the darkness so you can be darn sure nothing is hiding in the shadows.
Light up your home with rustic style. This electric wall lantern was created from reclaimed hand lanterns and retrofitted with LED filament bulbs for a beautiful, charming glow.

Your reflection is looking so good you could just about boogie with yourself all day. Tip your hat and compliment yourself with this free standing wooden mirror. You can take your moves and confidence over to the dance hall in town.
The resonator guitar is the rancher's preferred instrument for porch playing.\n\n<font color='#199C2C'>From the Rockin’ Rancher Digital Content</font>

It's guaranteed that this piano played some good tunes in its day and is ready to be enjoyed for many more years to come. Some say that this piano was once a part of the town's old saloon before it became the nectar bar.

Welcome to the one stop shop for all your Nectar Making needs! With this bad boy Sims can get started crafting simple Nectars, then work up to the big league recipes. Keep your Nectar corked and let it age to perfection. (Consider pairing with a Nectar rack to speed up the process!)

Any Nectar-enthusiasts favorite way to store their sweet, sweet Nectar! With room for thirteen bottles each, this storage rack can be stack vertically or side-by-side to line the walls of any Sim's dream Nectar Cellar... or left in solitude as a cute stand-alone cabinet.
Take in the beautiful sights of Ranch Life with these picturesque landscape paintings. Hang 'em on your walls, your mantle, or even your barn for all to enjoy!
Stacked neatly on a shelf, the counter, or wherever else you like! These metal plates are just what you need to bring your kitchen from basic barn to shabby chic!
This decorative Nectar storage barrel pairs well with your finest home-crafted refreshment. Just place it down and you already feel like you're in Nectar country!

Despite what people think when they first look at the area, there's plenty of good dirt for growing 'round these parts. That's why making Nectar is so popular! These flowers were the first sign of life in the area, and the locals generally like to keep them where they are.

This grass has been in the sun too long, and it's all dried out. The good news is that it still looks nice! The bad news is that it's always going to look like that. Maybe that's what you're into with your landscaping. No judgment here.
It may be a little overgrown, but that's part of the charm.

Don't leave anyone in any doubt about what you enjoy. Having a single (or multiple) Horseshoe Topiary will signal to everyone that this is where horses are welcome... as long as they don't try to eat it.
Who's got time to ride all the way back home when nature calls? No need to be ashamed! When motives are low, you gotta go!
Utility is what you need around the Ranch and this flower vase is a prime example of pulling double duty! Beautifying a space is important, but we Ranchers make sure that decoration serves a purpose!

It's pretty common to be all about multi-functionality on a ranch. Why an item with only one use when you can have one item with a lot of uses? The Floral Pitcher could hold some milk or water, but right now, it's holding some flowers. The best part is that it'll look right at home on any counter or table.
Display on your table, a shelf, or anywhere you like! This wild flower arrangement is meant to bring the outside in and turn a frown upside down!

It's not just a boulder... it's rocks! Add some nature back into your outdoor space with this collection of rocks. Make your land feel more like the environment around it, and add some natural style back in.
Give your structure (Barn or otherwise) some character with this turret! Plus, the windows will let sunshine in so you can't go wrong.

Sometimes, it can be hard to explain to insistent children why their favorite outside animal can't sleep inside with them. With the Inside Animals Rug, you'll be able to give them the animal they love with none of the mess and smell inside your house.

Not getting enough of hay outside on the ranch? Bring on the hay with this hay inspired rug that is sure to bring the outdoor ranch look inside so you don't have to miss it too much. Rug material not edible, even if it looks like real hay.
Need to add a little plushness and color to the room? This rug is sure to brighten up the space and warm up your feet, whether or not it's for a child's room or a sophisticated adult abode.
This rug is woven as tightly as the ranch community of Chestnut Ridge where Indigenous artisans made it. Its patterns and colors reflect the beauty of the land and sky.
This wood barrel that once held Nectar has been restored to have a second life as ranch décor.
This 55 gallon drum that once held Nectar has been restored to have a second life as ranch décor.
Who has time to clean when there is so much to be done on the Ranch? These go unused so much that it's almost like they're just decoration.

Ready for lunch, partner? This garden sculpture hearkens to the food truck of the old west, the chuck wagon. The "cookie" would cook up cowboy camp meals including Pan de Campo. Likewise, this gnome diligently provides for his imaginary ranch friends.
Flags where you need them, when you need them! These will pull attention to the places you need to be noticed. I guess that's a banner's purpose, huh?
The horse is our brother. He guides us in the quiet ways of being. He reveals understanding without language. He teaches humility and relationship. And he carries us to glory.
"Spirit of the Seeker" Lifesize Horse Statue
This compact trailer exudes "Simstagram Rancher life" and, yeah, it's purely decorative. For some folks, it's all about appearances, am I right?
These classy, decorative crates are filled with Nectarless bottles cradled by sweet-smelling Prairie Grass Hay.

This contraption squeezes juice via mechanical force from brawny arms. At least, it used to before the screw gunked up. That's alright, though, because feet-stomping leads to more flavor for some reason...
These artisanal storage boxes display nectar so picturesquely that it isn't for drinking! It's décor. Please just look, don't touch!

Mark the entrance to your ranch with a Rustic Welcoming Archway! It's tall, it's well-lit, and it's just cute. The plants don't need any taking care of, meaning that your ranch will always put its best foot forward when it comes to first impressions. Visitors will be in awe.
The best way to display Nectar Country Barrels to save space for... you guessed it! More Nectar!

Much like the matching bar, this grand back bar has been restored and designed to resemble an earlier time in the town. This is sure to make a bold statement for any bar with its full wooden structure reused from wood from town.

Don't want to get back in the saddle just yet? Not a problem! Show off that gorgeously crafted saddle on a place that just seems made for it. No one will know it's not there for a quick second while you get your horse ready.
Woah, Nelly! *Knocks on wood* This chest is as solid as they come. It will stand the test of time in safely storing your treasures... or junk... or Manure.
It may be small but this box is solid! This handmade wooden box ensures that its contents stay safe, complete with a sturdy latch and design.
Cormac Pine Solid State Storage Box
A ranch don't need nothin' fancy. Take this pump here: it's a water feature. Don't need a fountain when you have something even better.
Have some extra space above your head? Want to make your roof look less... well... plain? Add some windows and the charm will go through the roof!
Basket weaving has been passed down for generations, preserving the art of hand-making a container utilitarian enough to hold water and beautiful enough to honor those who came before us.
Crafted by local Indigenous artisans, this jug celebrates unity and devotion through its two handles that double as spouts.
We're cooking up something good! Well, as long as we have the counter space free to do so. This kitchen clutter may be in the way, but it certainly looks useful!
Put it on the Table Kitchen Clutter
This basket has got you covered! No need to rummage through drawers or cupboards for items! Everything you need is neatly organized here, so just sit down and enjoy the grub!
Not a Care in the World Utensil Basket
Add a touch of practicality to your kitchen with this reliable and well-used metal pot. It's not much to look at but who expects a pot to be a focal point in their home design?
Sweetgrass, sage, and palo santo are special to the Native Sims of Chestnut Ridge.
This cask is perfect for placing on any counter, table, or surface to make sure you have easy access to cure what ails ya!

Coming in third in a competition is definitely still a big deal. Have the award to show it! Display it proudly in your home to tell the world that you and your horse are pretty darn good at competing.
Look at you! You and your horse came in first place. As truly the champion of champions, it's only right to show off a little. Display this somewhere where you know no one will be able to miss it.

Took home the silver this time? Show it off! Be proud of what you and your horse have accomplished. You might not have been first this time around, but silver is just as cool to show off in your home.

Built with planks that were laying around the barn, the Ranch Home Shutter adds a little flair to any home. Just make sure you know which side is which when you're adding them to your home! No bathroom is complete without the hospitality of a good towel shelf. Options come in natural, stained, or painted wood for the quaint country feel. Good for any bathroom or storage area so a fresh clean towel is always in reach.
Where have your boots been? Perhaps you can't find them, so find a place to put your decorative pair! Also, a safe place to store items that should be kept subtly away from the main view.

On a ranch, it can be hard to keep the dirt, dust, and mud from entering the rest of your home. With these cubbies, at least you can give your home a fighting chance. Leave anything particularly dirty there and hopefully the rest of the home stays clean!

The Sturdy Clothing Rack was crafted with the very best lumber available. With superior crafting, some nails, and a whole lot of glue, this clothing rack can hold just about anything you would want to wear without any issues. Somehow, there's always more space when you need it.

The ranch lifestyle means wasting nothing. True to that mantra, this china cabinet was built from spare wood that was left after the barn was raised. It holds the "nice" dishes, and some other knick-knacks that have made their way into the cabinet for safe-keeping over time.

This hutch, like most things when it comes to ranches, is here to be functional. It's just lucky that it's also pleasing to view, and doesn't look out of place in the home. It's going to hold everything you need it to and be sturdy as the trees outside that have been growing for the last hundred years.
Who leaves their ranch tools laying around all willy-nilly? Not you! Hanging them up after a long day of honest work helps you rest easy knowing you are prepared for the next day.
There's something special about coming home to the Ranch and hanging up your hat for the day. This decorative wall shelf will remind you of living on love on the Ranch.

There are just some things that are too precious to leave out. With animals and kids and clumsy Sims everywhere, it's safer to keep them put away. With the Raised Ranch Curio Cabinet, you can be sure your belongings will be well off the ground and totally safe.

After a long day of ranching, a shower sure feels great. Made with natural wood that's lightly stained to match the rustic set. While a shower is a great pick-me-up, it can be quick enough to get in and get out, there's still ranching to be done!

Giddy on up and be warmly greeted by this quaint chalkboard sign. Fancy chalk doodles keep the street clean and eyes on the mane event, which is all right here, and beckoning you over to find out more.

This Ranch Sign says it all about your reputation and ranch so you don't have to — rock-solid foundation, simple principles, straight shooting, and a humble light for your slice of the world.\n\nCustomize with Iron Works Signage or other Wall Décor

This Ranch Sign declares to every visitor in rugged frontiersman style: “You have arrived.” Or “Until next time,” depending on which way they are going.\n\nCustomize with Iron Works Signage or other Wall Décor
Brand Bearer Ranch Sign: Ace High
Your hands sure do get dirty working on a ranch and scratching the necks of all the horses that you see. This sink is built to provide top notch hand cleaning for the dirtiest of hands.

You can lead a Rancher to the bar, but can you make them drink? It won't really matter because this barstool is so appealing that it's good enough for simply sitting or finding a place to order a glass of nectar comfortably.

Let's be honest: Animals have style. Why should they keep it all to themselves? Those patterns would look great... well... everywhere! This chair means to get to show off your favorite animal patterns wherever you sit without having to housetrain those animals.

Even if you tried, it'd be really hard to break this dining chair. Given its solid materials, and flawless assembly, you could probably stand on it to change some light bulbs and it wouldn't even feel wobbly. No one likes being unsteady when they eat.
After working so hard, sitting down and relaxing can be the best thing you've ever felt. Verily, this chair offers the plushest cushions made of the softest leather ever known.
A compact stool built to fit the narrowest of spaces. Made from solid pine, this stool is naturally durable, easy to clean, and environmentally friendly.

Is your chair getting a little too much manure on it after you sit down after a day on the ranch? Look no more: this chair has the country charm but covered by a graceful blanket to hide any dirt marks.

Superior crafting went into making this stool, and it has definitely paid off. Is it old? Maybe. Is it new but in an old style? That's also a possibility. Either way, the thing looks perfect, and is sturdy as ever.

After a long day of working, there's nothing quite like getting to just sit down. This love seat, made of once extra lumber, is here to let you (and maybe a loved one) rest your tired ol' bones and maybe take in a sunset if you're lucky.

Solid construction means you can rest assured it will last a lifetime (or until someone mistakes it for firewood). Perfect for indoors. Or place it outdoors to enjoy a warm fire, golden sunset, or the sparkling evening stars.
This rustic hand-hewn bench may not be comfortable on the backside, but you can distract yourself by daydreaming about how burly its craftsman must have been. Maybe his name was Hewn Jackman.

This ottoman can also offer additional space for guests before the cookout takes everybody outside. Soft textures with the variety of pattern, you'll be sure to find the perfect fit with your living set.

Star-quality rocking chair durability for use on your Ranch. The Rocking Star has been stress tested to allow you to rock at up to 120 bpm. Good luck with that.\n\n<font color='#199C2C'>From: Rockin’ Rancher Digital Content</font>

Gather 'round and hear a tale about the most spectacular craftsmanship in all the land. Rock all night on this solid seat. It might creak a little but rest assured that this beauty will outlast us all!
Ready to cozy up after a hard day's work and horseback riding? With plush pillows and vintage appeal, this sofa provides respite for the weary rancher.
How charming! This quaint radio isn't just fun to look at. Crank up the sound and get your dance on! Whether you do it in a line, in a circle, or in a square, you'll enjoy the impressive sound!
This wall-mounted stereo is perfect for making any Community Venue feel right at home on the ranch.
This coffee table is a mix of elegant charm mixed with country chic. The wooden craftsmanship made to match any room design anywhere from a ranch in the canyons to a room in the charming downtown.

Nothing more like a ranch than a large grand table to hold a scrumptious array of food. Whether it's served indoors or outdoors, this table will be the perfect setting for gatherings after a long work day.
Perfect for a cozy country dining room. Reclaimed but polished wood gives it a rustic appeal where the large round top gives it a glamour appeal.

Simplicity at its finest with a stability meant to last. Don't confuse this with your end table with a wobble in its leg, this table will endure and adds a loveliness to the room with its rounded top and carved wood legs.

This humble end table is crafted using traditional woodworking methods that are simple, functional, and beautiful. Instead of nails, screws, or other metal fasteners, it uses Mortise and Tenon joints for unparalleled build quality.

Need more storage in your home? Maybe you just have a lot of knick-knacks with nowhere to live. Corral all those items into one spot, and show them off on this sturdy console table. Just remember to dust it once in a while because it also corrals dust.
Here may the Horse find everlasting freedom in the wild outdoors.
This rancher is full of beans - figuratively and literally - ready to ride into any adventure imaginative youngsters dream up.
A hay-flavored treat that can be fed to a Foal or Horse to instantly age it up.
Ambrosia-infused treat that can be fed to a ghost Horse to bring it back to life.
Did you know Mesquite trees have deep-branching roots to find water? This tree certainly did that, and look at it now! What more could you ask for from a tree?
Well... this tree has certainly seen better days. Someone should probably cut it down for firewood one of these days. Maybe a bit of grilling? It won't do much else for anyone right now.
Much like the wild grass around it, this tree has adapted to the environment and thrived. Its dainty leaves only add beauty to the area around it.

If there's one thing you want to protect, it's the family TV! Crafted out of the finest wood that can be found, no rambunctious kids or pets will manage to bump a TV off of this stand. As an added bonus, there's also storage space.
An urn to keep your noble steed nearby after their spirit moves on.

A classic water trough for thirsty Horses and Foals around the ranch! Any good rancher knows that some cold water is the best way to help a Fatigued Horse after a day of training. Your Livestock might also enjoy lapping up the leftover puddles.

Unlike some plants, Prairie Grass grows with no Sim care required. Prairie Grass is proud to be a perfect food source (Hay!) for Ranch Animals if ranching just isn't your thing. Prairie Grass doesn't judge.
Harvested Prairie Grass that Ranch Animals love to eat. Can be fed by hand and stocked in Animal Feeders.
Give the ranch house style a refresh with the addition of these windows with a modern twist. With a wood trim and iron, these windows are as reinforced as they are stylish.
Need a window that's taller than it is wide but just as attractive? The Country Rustic Tall Window is the verticality you need without compromising any of the charm you want in a rustic window.

Something about your home not looking quite right? Can't fit another big window in? With natural wood and iron bars, this narrow window will give you the design pop you need and sunlight that you'll love.
It's hard to resist having just one of these country classic windows. They seem to pair up in groups like they were made for each other's company.
Give your stall's occupants the sunlight or view of what's going on that they might want without endangering them. These strong metal bars that keep them in without keeping light out.

The black iron windows are all the rage right now and give a modern twist to the ranch house design. These windows have a natural wood trim to complement the new modern style. They also include interior locks for a reinforced look.

This window is shaped like a mountain being held up by modern black iron bars. Great for maintaining privacy while being able to let sunshine stream through the room or laying in a bed and looking up into the sky.
Modern Ranch Life High Peak Window
Rein in the scenery while gazing out on the ranch. You won't miss a golden moment of it with this large wood paneled window that reaches from floor to ceiling.

There's nothing better than a rustic style, and lots of sunlight. With a tall window like the Rancher's Dream Window, every home will feel like a dream come true. The best part is being able to look out to the ranch and see the fruits of the occupant's labors.

The Big and Prairie Window might be a fright to clean, but with the views it can offer? The benefits far outweigh the ladder you'd need to clean them. This window ensures no amount of sunlight goes to waste.
Give your stall's occupants a panoramic view of what's going on around them. Keep them safe with strong metal bars that keep them in without keeping light out.

Maximize the view of your lovely ranch with an equally lovely large window. Each pane makes up a grand window that makes the home feel a little less inside and a little more like it's an extension of what's going on outside.

Close your eyes and picture it: you're working in the barn, and it's a little musty. How does a barn not have more airflow? So, you go to open the shutters to see a friend or loved one working nearby. You can lean out and say "Hay there!"

This cabin is the perfect respite for anyone looking to relax after a long day of horseback trail riding! It is central to all the vistas Galloping Gulch offers and gives plenty of space to train and care for Ranch Animals. Whether fishing, exploring, or going for a swim, this cabin will be warm and cozy when you turn in for the day.
This scenic outlook is a perfect place to saddle up and hit the trails. This area is ideal for gazing across the canyon, admiring the natural rock bridge, and exploring all the mysterious wonders.

Mentor to Sienna and Umber's mother, this legendary Horse Champion retired and settled in Galloping Gulch with his trusty steed, Duke, to live a life of simple pleasures. Don and Duke enjoy the spoils of their hard work in the vast beauty of the Gulch.

Do you want to enjoy the sights and sounds of the Gulch without being cramped in a tiny cabin? Big Sky Reach is the perfect destination for you. This luxurious, yet rustic, rental property is a hot commodity among the equestrians venturing in and out of Chestnut Ridge. Spend the day riding with your equine pal and mosey on back to a warm fire and cozy bed.

Surrounded by the beautiful community of Riders' Glen, this plot of land is prime real estate for anyone looking to start a ranch of their own. Whether for Horses, Mini Goats, or Mini Sheep (or all the above!), this is an ideal area to create precious memories with your Ranch Animal friends.

Tucked away on the side of the Glen, this picturesque pocket of land provides privacy and beautiful scenery while being close to the rest of the community. This also is a great spot for any Sim looking to take up Nectar Making.

This duo is working to get their name out into the Nectar Making scene. Marissa uses her outgoing personality and ambition to network. Dani is a connoisseur who lives for the delicate intricacies of their craft in Nectar Making. Their relationship can be strained at times, but, deep down, they have each other's back.
Trusty Steed Rock, or "Ol' Biscuit," watches over this land as the ever-present, larger-than-life sentinel of the Glen.

Umber and Juniper became childhood sweethearts when Umber would serenade Juniper with odes to her Equestrian prowess after taking Horse Riding lessons from his mother. When Umber's parents passed away, he took on the family ranch to honor his native heritage and his sister, Sienna, became the Horse Trainer in town. The son, Wren, has a passion for animals and is training Starbrite, the foal of Umber's childhood rescue horse, Luna... all set to the sweet, peaceful soundtrack of Umber's odes on the porch.

This property is perfect for those looking to indulge in dynamic craft of Nectar Making. The inspiring views and breathtaking surroundings provide a luxurious environment for Nectar enthusiasts. Impress your neighborhoods with an elegant estate that will have the entire glen talking.

This ready-to-go home is perfect for multiple folks ready to dive into the world of Livestock and Horses. Surrounded by the friendly community of the Glen, this is an excellent starting point for any aspiring equestrian.

This quaint, cozy cottage on the outskirts of the main promenade is perfect for raising Mini Goats and Mini Sheep! It was one of the first homes built in New Appaloosa and has since been remodeled while keeping its rustic, homey feel. Complete with a small pen and Animal Feeder for your four-legged friends.

Throughout New Appaloosa's history, this lush grove has been home to many notable Equestrian Ultimate Champions. Its serene environment creates a beautiful relaxation spot for champ and Horse alike. The Sims and structures may have changed over the years, but this spot will always draw top-notch equestrians to call it home.

As a multiple-time Ultimate Horse Championship winner with her Horse, Salt Lake Flapjack (or “Flapjack” for short), Sienna is happy to share her indigenous wisdom and train Horses to become skilled competitors. After her parents passed and her brother took over the family ranch, she began training and competing full-time. She now runs the Hay Now! Equestrian Center, where she serves as an encouraging and knowledgeable mentor for aspiring equestrians.

Yee haw! Come on down to the Rusty Horseshoe for a grand old time! No need to worry about being all fancy like those Nectar folks. The Rusty Horseshoe Dance Hall welcomes all types and promises good company, food, and boot-stomping Ranch Dancing. Come say howdy and take a load off after a day of hard work on the ranch!

If you want to be among fellow Nectar afficionados, The Oak Barrel is the spot for you to test your palate with Nectar's delicate complexities. Classy with rustic elegance, it offers a flavor-filled respite from work.

Duke's Hall, named after the trusty steed of legendary Ultimate Horse Champion Don Gooseman, has everything riders and Horses need to rest and prepare for the next competition. It also includes a social space to chat with fellow Horse lovers. Make Don and Duke proud by winning that Ultimate Horse Championship!
It's always exciting to welcome a new Horse to the Household. This Horse is going to need a name...

Agility affects how quickly and easily a Horse can move! Horses with high Agility are better at using Horse Barrels, completing certain Community Jobs, and performing in the Barrel Racing, Western Pleasure, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nA Horse's Agility Skill is built by training with Horse Barrels. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Community Board.

Endurance is all about how resilient a Horse is! A horse with high Skill in Endurance will become Fatigued less often, do better at certain Community Jobs and the Endurance Race, Show Jumping, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nEndurance Skill is built by going for rides. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Community Board.

Horses with high Jumping Skill love to reach for new heights! They are better at using Horse Jumps, certain Community Jobs, and the Show Jumping, Endurance Racing, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nA Horse's Jumping Skill is built by training with the Horse Jumps. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Community Board.

Horses with high Temperament Skill buck less often when being ridden and get along more easily with Sims and other Horses. They are also better at certain Community Jobs and the Western Pleasure, Show Jumping, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nA Horse's Temperament Skill is built when a Sim cares for and socializes with that Horse. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Community Board.

There are many chores involved with maintaining a successful ranch, such as taking care of animals, gardening, cleaning, and manure management. Smelly, but essential! Work-life balance is critical to improving your mood and, in turn, your productivity!
Have you hosted a Ranch Animal Day yet on your ranch? It's a great way to make friends, give your animals some social interaction, and make some extra Simoleons!
Horses will produce higher quality manure the better cared for they are. This manure can be great as fertilizer!
Nectar quality is directly influenced by the quality of the ingredients used, and the skill level of the Sim doing the stomping.
Make sure your horse has somewhere to sleep! Horse beds can be purchased in Build Mode, and horses can be assigned to beds in Live Mode.
The key to a successful ranch is maintaining the happiness of your animals! Treat them like you'd treat your own family!
If you're struggling to win competitions with your horse, try making sure your horse is in a good mood, and your Sim and horse have the recommended skill levels for the competition!
Don't ride horses facing backwards! Trust me, I've tried.
The Equestrian Center is open from 7 AM to 7 PM every day. Competing with your Horse is a great way to earn income for your ranch!
Spinach, spinach, spinach. That is half the battle.
My friend, earn my trust further, and I will share more... But know it's all about the nectar.
Who me? My life backstory is of little importance to me now, what's intriguing is how I continue on...
I usually only talk about such things with trusted friends... What I will say is that ranching truly saved my life...

The Hay Now! Equestrian Center is the perfect place to compete or spectate various Horse Riding competitions, such as Barrel Racing, Show Jumping, Endurance Racing, and Western Pleasure. Win them all and become an Ultimate Champion!\n\nYou can also Train, Purchase, Rescue, or Sell Horses at the Equestrian Center.

Horses can be Purchased and Sold for Simoleons. A Horse's value depends on their Skill Levels, past Competition Performance, quality of care, and age. If a Horse has Champion Genes this will also increase their value. Horses can also be Rescued at a reduced fee. Due to the environment they came from, rescue Horses will have more difficult Traits, and extra attention and care may be needed. To Purchase, Rescue, or Sell a Horse visit the Phone's Home menu and select Call Ranch Animal Exchange, go to a Computer's Household category, or visit the Equestrian Center in Chestnut Ridge's New Appaloosa Neighborhood.

Made with: Any Berry and/or Berry-based Ingredient Effects: Helps Sims feel happy. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.

The profile of sweet, tart, bitter, and earthen berry flavors in this Nectar perfectly reflects the creative journey of its creator: a mix of good, bad, all that life has to offer... and in the end, it all worked out.\n

Made with: Any Fruit and/or Fruit-based Ingredient Effects: Helps Sims feel happy. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
The ultimate creative expression for master Nectar makers.\n

Made with: Apple Effects: Helps Sims feel inspired. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, inspiration persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.

A crisp, clean Nectar with a bright and bold entrance, balanced profile, and buttery mouthfeel. This inspiring classic goes down smooth and doesn't overstay its welcome. The perfect companion for a fancy picnic.\n

Made with: Lemon, Any Herb Effects: Helps Sims feel happy and staves off sleep for a short time. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, Sims get a bit more Energy and happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.

Originally an attempt at homemade Powersip, this Nectar recipe's simple ingredients produce an electrifying, energetic flavor. This drink is all class, no sleep. It's like lemonade for fancy people who can't sit still.\n

Made with: Grape Effects: Helps Sims feel confident. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, a confident feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
The original, classic Nectar. This drink is the belle of any ball for any occasion. Any Sim who enjoys this beverage will know, deep down, that fancy is a state of mind.\n

Made with: Death Flower, Spinach Effects: Helps Sims feel happy. Extends vitality for the living by a little, and for the dead by a lot. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, Sims get a bit more vitality and a happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.

This "beverage," if it can even be called that, is not so much a culinary invention as a bizarre alchemical joke: the overwhelming crush of death itself, flipped upside down by the humble spinach. It goes to show that the right skill and ingredients can turn an end into a beginning.\n

Made with: Moonpetal Flower Effects: Helps Sims feel happy. Werewolves may enjoy an increased sense of calm. Beware: Any Werewolf who drinks too much will surely struggle to maintain control... If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, calming effect for Werewolves increases. A happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
Run, howl, cast off the fetters of the mind, feel the wet earth between your claws, sip delicately, repeat. (Repeat at your own risk.)\n

Made with: Plasma Fruit Effects: Helps Vampire Sims feel happy and refreshed. Non-Vampires should avoid. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, Vampire refreshment greatly increases. A happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged."
