A gorgeous and understated Nectar. Vampires possessed of the most sophisticated tastes will find this drink is all sweetness, no bite. Non-vampires who drink this will feel sick, even the fancy ones. There, now you know.\n

Made with: Potato Effects: Helps Sims feel especially happy, or the opposite if they overdo it. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, the consequences of overdoing it are significantly reduced. A happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. (Unless Sim overdid it, then all bets are off.) Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and adverse effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
Everyone thought Potato Nectar was madness. They said it wouldn't work. They were wrong. In fact, the resulting Nectar is quite drinkable, though its effects are strong. Drink responsibly!\n

Made with: Strawberry Effects: Helps Sims feel flirty. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, a flirty feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and negative effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
Sweet strawberry flavors tumble across the palate, frolicking together and igniting the senses. Fall in love with this Nectar, and maybe also the consenting individual next to you!\n

Made with: Trash Fruit Effects: Helps Sims feel happy while making them a bit smelly. Animals seem to respond quite positively. Having Nectar that is at least Lightly Aged will improve the smell. A happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and adverse effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
Uncommon Nectar demands uncommon ingredients. Likewise, this Nectar is a taste to be acquired, not simply taken in-hand like any ordinary, pedestrian beverage.\n

Made with: Valerian Root Effects: Helps Sims feel happy, with a little something extra for Spellcasters. If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, Spellcaster effects increase significantly. A happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and adverse effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
Valerian Nectar won't win any taste awards, but keen Spellcasters will be more interested in the contents: distilled essence of the Valerian Root. Perfect for Spellcaster dinner parties.\n

Made with: Prairie Grass Effects: Helps Sims feel happy and reduces tension. Surprisingly filling! If Nectar is at least Lightly Aged, tension and Hunger reduction is stronger. A happy feeling persists after Nectar wears off. Aging: Leave Nectar bottles unopened to let them age. Once a bottle reaches "Lightly Aged," positive effects are enhanced and adverse effects are reduced. Nectar bottles gain maximum Simoleon value when they reach "Finely Aged." Nectar will age moderately faster if stored in a basement or cellar, or significantly faster if stored in a Nectar Rack.
A Nectar that's good before, during, and after a busy day on the ranch.\n

A staple in Ranch Life, Prairie Grass grows and thrives just about anywhere with no Sim care required. Prairie Grass is an excellent food source for Ranch Animals, who will nibble on any Prairie Grass they can get access to. Sims can also harvest it for Prairie Grass Hay. Grass that is harvested or grazed on by animals will take time to grow back.

Prairie Grass Hay, harvested and bundled into a healthy treat for your Horses, Mini Sheep and Mini Goats! Sims can feed Ranch Animals by hand, or use Prairie Grass Hay to restock a Hay Now! Animal Feeder.
A product of hard work between Sims and nature.
Saddle? Check. Reins? Check. Horse? Double check. This guide will tell you all you need to know about Horse Riding.
Horse Riding has transformed over the years. Deep dive into the history of the art and discover why modern techniques have become standard.
Mounting and Dismounting in the Modern Era
A how-to guide on Horse Riding that will impress any horse!
Collect bottles by interacting with Nectar Rack or using Live Drag.

Action-packed Westerns that are accompanied not by dialogue but by music.
Children and their Horses experiencing adventures and building friendships!
Ranch life can be hard, but don't worry! Cormac Pine has put its classic bunk in a convenient package so friends can rest rustically.
Write your tales of the trails close to the comfort of your own bed for maximum efficiency. After all, a Sim's life is made out of the days it’s made out of.

The best way to learn this Skill is to hop-on-up in the Saddle and get riding! Any time this is happening a rider will be actively improving their Riding Skill—whether out for a leisurely ride or actively training a Horse's Agility, Jumping, or Endurance Skills.

Enter Competitions at the Equestrian Center. To do this, travel to any lot in Chestnut Ridge's New Appaloosa Neighborhood with a Horse. Then select the Equestrian Center and choose to Enter Competitions.
Win Gold in 5 Master Horse Competitions

Place 1st Place for Gold in a Barrel Racing, Endurance, Show Jumping, or Western Pleasure competition at the Equestrian Center. To do this, travel to any lot in Chestnut Ridge's New Appaloosa Neighborhood with a Horse. Select the Equestrian Center and choose Enter Competitions. Select a Master level Competition from the Barrel Racing, Endurance Racing, Show Jumping, or Western Pleasure Competition categories. Place 1st Place for Gold in these Competitions. Tip: Confident Horses as well as Horses and riders with higher Skill Level in applicable Competition types will perform better.
Place at the Ultimate Horse Championship

Place 1st, 2nd, or 3rd in the Ultimate Horse Championship. Competitions are on Saturdays. To enter, travel to any lot in Chestnut Ridge's New Appaloosa Neighborhood with a Horse. Select the Hay Now! Equestrian Center and choose Enter Competitions. Alternatively, enter from a Ranch Community Board. Tip: Confident Horses as well as Horses and riders with higher Skill Level in applicable Competition types tend to perform better.

Excellent Quality Nectar is the best possible Nectar that can be produced. Current Skill Level, Ingredient Quality, and the Skill Level required to craft a bottle of Nectar all impact the quality of each Nectar bottle. To increase the chance of crafting Excellent Nectar, try improving Nectar Making Skill, growing high quality plants for Ingredients, or making sure a Sim is in a good mood while they are crafting.

Select a bottle of Nectar and select Sell or Drag here to sell in a Sim's Inventory. The Mysterious Rancher who periodically appears around Chestnut Ridge is also willing to buy!

Various factors impact how much each bottle of Nectar can sell for. To increase the amount of Simoleons earned from each bottle consider the following:
• Nectar price increases from Not Yet Aged, to Lightly Aged, to Moderately Aged, and peaks at Finely Aged.
• Nectar price increases from Poor Quality to Normal Quality, and peaks at Excellent Quality. Try using high quality Ingredients to improve the quality of Nectar.
• Nectars that require more Nectar Making Skill to craft are worth more. Improve Nectar Making Skill to craft more difficult Nectars.
• The Mysterious Rancher will pay more money for Nectar than selling it regularly will.

In Build Mode, go to the Outdoor Activities category in the Outdoor section. Place down a Rootin' Fruit'n Nectar Maker on the active lot. Harvest ingredients from a garden or buy them, then choose to Craft Nectar. As your Sim produces Nectar they will level up their Nectar Making Skill.
This charming banister is made from the finest local wood and adds the finishing touch to a log cabin home.

The Rustic Ranch Railing has all the hallmarks of being well-loved. It's clear it's been here for a while, and it's still as sturdy as can be. No need to worry about a wobbly railing to make those stairs unsafe.
There is no available Nectar Maker.
As a master of Horse Riding, record your teachings for posterity. Future generations of Horses will thank you.
Grill a Pot of Bison Stew
Grill a Pot of Wild Nut Soup

This community formed when several groups embraced their mutual connection to Horses and the land. The area, with its beautiful, expansive landscape, soon became known as a hub for raising and training Horses. Over time, it also became famous for Nectar Making thanks to its rich, red soil. The town flourished and became the Chestnut Ridge it is today.
{0.SimFirstName} saw {1.SimFirstName} come into the world. {0.SimPronounSubjective|xxUpper} can't wait to see {1.SimPronounObjective} grow!
{1.SimFirstName} tried to bite {0.SimFirstName}, so {0.SimPronounSubjective} is feeling aggrieved.
{1.SimFirstName} drank straight from that Nectar bottle! They couldn't possibly have appreciated the color, aroma, or finish!
{0.SimFirstName} feels grateful {1.SimFirstName} is willing to help with ALL aspects of ranch life!
Did they just...but...why? {0.SimFirstName} can't understand why {0.SimPronounPossessiveDependent} favorite animal had to go!
{1.SimFirstName} has led {0.SimFirstName} to the 1st place trophy! {0.SimFirstName} won't soon forget it.

These Sims train Horse Skills faster, sell Horses for higher prices, inspire confidence in themselves and their Horse when riding and training, and will very rarely have a bad time riding a Horse. In fact, they are so good with Horses that Horses have even more fun when being ridden by them. They can also Give Competition Advice to aspiring Horse riders.
Bronze Level grants a mini-sized donation from Guests towards the Ranch... Don't spend it all in one place!

Of course, guest expectations for Ranch Animal Day were high, but, unfortunately, satisfaction was low. You might say that the Guests donated a mini amount of Simoleons to the Ranch. Get it? The animals will be sad.
Sadly, the Guests were underwhelmed by this gathering. They left a thimble-sized donation of Simoleons out of pity. Guess the ranch is going to have to find another way to pay the bills.
Guests are ready and eager to donate Simoleons to the Ranch. How much? Well, that depends on how successful the event is.

Wow, what a party! Some might even call you a...Party Animal! The animals who joined in on the event certainly are! Everyone left thrilled and completely satisfied. The guests have donated a bushel of Simoleons for the Ranch. Time to pamper all those animals!

Few Sims have been to a shindig quite like this one! The Guests will be talking about this Ranch Gathering for weeks to come! They donated a bushel of Simoleons to the Ranch! Yee haw! Maybe it's time for some upgrades?
Silver Level grants a reasonable donation from Guests towards the Ranch. That's one way to make some hard-earned money!

It was great seeing Sims and animals come together for an event of fluff and fun! It could have a been a better event, but it also could have been much worse! The guests came together to donate a reasonable amount of Simoleons to the Ranch. Maybe the animals deserve something for their efforts?
The Guests had a decent time at the Ranch Gathering. They've certainly seen better events though. They left a modest donation of Simoleons to help out around the Ranch.
These Sims can craft pre-aged Nectar, have an iron bladder when it comes to drinking Nectar, and their negative emotions have less influence on their current mood.

Everything about this roof screams lived-in. No two shingles are alike after years of holding bad weather at bay. Not to worry: in this case, "rustic" is not a code word for "broken." It's been patched over the years, and it'll still keep your home nice and dry...until it needs another patching.
I am used to tough work as a Ranch Hand, but I have standards, too. I'm heading to greener pastures.

Horses, Mini Sheep, and Mini Goats, oh my! Caring and playing with these animals might just be another day on the Ranch for some, but for friends and community members it can be a fun-and-fluff-filled event! Get together and celebrate what these Ranch Animals bring to the world!

Say howdy to family and friends with a Ranch Gathering! Pull up a barrel, there's Ranch Music, Cowpoke Dancing, Grilling, Nectar, and all the neighborly socialization a Sim could want! Experience an unforgettable day on the Ranch!
Observe the Conversation Panel at the top center of the screen to see a Guest's Mood when interacting with them. Then perform positive interactions to help put them in a Happy Mood.
Select a Guest and navigate through the Pie Menu to the Funny Category. Then choose an interaction from within the Jokes sub menu.
Select Guests and interact with them.
Craft Nectar at the Nectar Maker
As the Host, place a Nectar Maker from Build Mode onto the lot. Then craft some Nectar.
Guests will automatically attempt to Feed Animals when Mini Goats, Mini Sheep, and Horses are present on the lot.
Guests will automatically attempt to Socialize with Animals when Mini Goats, Mini Sheep, and Horses are present on the lot.
Have Guests Socialize with Ranch Animals
Guests will automatically attempt to Pet Animals when Mini Goats, Mini Sheep, and Horses are present on the lot.
Guests will automatically Play with Mini Goats and Mini Sheep when they are present on the lot.
Have Guests Play with a Mini Goat or Mini Sheep

Have a Household Sim be Friends with a Mini Goat or Mini Sheep. When Guests are nearby, interact with Mini Goats by selecting Ask to Yell or Ask to Play Dead or Mini Sheep by selecting Ask to Roll Over or Ask to Shake in the Social Pie Menu Category.
Have Guests Watch Mini Animal Tricks
Have an Active Sim Introduce themselves to Guests or socialize with them if they've already met before.

Have a Household Sim be Friends with a Mini Goat or Mini Sheep. Interact with Mini Goats by selecting Ask to Yell or Ask to Play Dead or Mini Sheep by selecting Ask to Roll Over or Ask to Shake in the Social Pie Menu Category.
Do Tricks with Mini Goats or Sheep
Select a Mini Goat, Mini Sheep, or Horse and choose a Feed interaction from within the Care or Horse Care Pie Menu category.
Guests will automatically attempt to Hug Animals when Mini Goats, Mini Sheep, and Horses are present on the lot.
Have Guests Hug a Ranch Animal
Select a Horse, Mini Sheep, or Mini Goat and choose the Hug interaction.
Select any livestock Animal and perform social interactions with them.
Select a Mini Goat or Mini Sheep. Choose the Socialize category in the Pie Menu, and then choose to Pet the animal.
Select a Mini Goat or Mini Sheep. Choose the Socialize category in the Pie Menu, and then choose to Play with the animal.
Perform a Cowpoke Dance by either selecting any Stereo and choosing Cowpoke Dance or by selecting a Dance Floor and choosing Cowpoke Dance.
As the Host, grab a serving from any dish that was made on a grill.
Have Guests Perform a Cowpoke Dance
Have Guests Perform Cowpoke Dance by choosing to Cowpoke Dance Together on any Radio or Dance Floor or Cowpoke Group Dance on a Dance Floor.
Ensure Nectar Bottles or Nectar Glasses are readily available and Guests will naturally drink. If Nectar isn't available use the Nectar Maker to Craft Nectar.
Ensure grilled meals are readily available and Guests will naturally eat when they are hungry. If food isn't available, place down a Grill and make some food on it for the guests.
Select a Campfire and choose Invite to Hang Out. Do this with guests.
Have Guests Hang Out Around a Firepit
As a Host, select a lit Campfire and Invite to Hang Out guests.
As a Host, place a Campfire from Build mode and light it. Alternatively, you can add Logs or Fuel to one that is already lit.
Listen to Ranch Music by selecting any Stereo and choosing to Listen to Ranch music. If music is already playing you can also change the active station to Ranch music.
Interact with a Horse and choose to do positive interactions with them.
Hover over a Horse to see their Needs. Interact with them to help fill any Needs that need to be met.
Age your Nectar in a Nectar Rack purchased in Build Mode.
Go to the Equestrian Center and choose a Master level Horse Competition in any category to sign up!
Have a Friendly interaction with a Horse
On another Sim, open the "Friendly" category, choose "Deep Thoughts," and then select "Discuss Fear of Horses."
Select a Horse and either select Go for a Ride or Mount and choose Go for Intense Ride.
Select a Horse and either select Go for a Ride or Mount and choose Go for Energetic Ride.
Select a Horse and either select Go for a Ride or Mount and choose Go for Relaxed Ride.
Select a Horse and choose Mount. Then select the Horse and choose Go for Relaxed, Energetic, or Intense Ride.
Interact with a Horse in a positive way and improve the relationship between them and this Sim until they become Friends.
Using the Nectar Maker available in Outdoor Objects in the Buy Catalog, select the Craft Nectar interaction to start the process of creating a new Bottle of Nectar.
Make an Excellent Bottle of Nectar
Having a high Nectar Making Skill and using better ingredients will make it more likely to craft an Excellent Quality Bottle of Nectar.
Use the Craft Nectar interaction on a Nectar Maker to craft Bottle of Nectar using Ingredients in the Sim's Inventory.
Select a Horse and either Mount Horse or Go for a Ride.
Hop on up in the saddle and get riding! A mounted Sim's Horse Skill will improve naturally while the Horse is moving.
Interact with the Nectar Maker object and make some Nectar to level this Skill.
Interact with another Sim. Select the Funny Pie Menu Category, then Jokes. Then Tell Joke about Horse, of Course. Children can also Tell Joke about Horse Butts.
Have your Sim and a Horse use Horse Jumps or Horse Barrels for training.
Select the Equestrian Center or Ranch Community Board and select Enter Competitions. Then place 1st.
Select the Equestrian Center or Ranch Community Board and choose Enter Competitions. Select a Master or Ultimate Competition and win 1st place.
Socialize in a Friendly way a Mini Sheep or Mini Goat.
Interact with a Horse owned by your Sim and select Encourage to Breed
Find some fully grown Prairie Grass and either Harvest it or Harvest All.
Rub or Scratch a Horse's Neck
Try befriending a Horse and then Scratch or Rub Neck.
Choose Refill Feeder on an empty Animal Feeder.
Select the Sell interaction on a Bottle of Nectar or Drag here to sell in a Sim's inventory.
Hire a Grill Master to scrounge up some grub for the Ranch Gathering! They'll also clean up the extra dishes, so those attending can focus on the fun!
Have Multiple Animal Feeders to Keep Animals Fed
Have a Grill for Making Grilled Food
Have a Nectar Maker for Crafting and Drinking Nectar
Have a Dance Floor for Cowpoke Dancing
Have a Stereo for Cowpoke Dancing and Listening to Ranch Music
Hiring an Animal Tender will ensure that your animals are kept clean, Animal Feeders have feed readily available, and those pesky piles of Horse Manure get removed.

Congratulations! In a fine display of Agility and Endurance, the title of 1st Place in the Beginners Bracket is yours. The crowd goes wild as a new up-and-comer is born! Keep practicing and competing, and you'll be Ultimate Champion in no time!

An admirable effort awards you 3rd place! You may not have taken the whole competition, but you've put on a display with the crowd cheering your names. A few wobbling barrels stood between you and the top prize, so keep training, and 1st Place is on the horizon!
Well done! Your hard-working duo made it to 2nd Place. You had a few minor inefficiencies rounding the barrels, but with a little more practice, you can take the top spot!
Keep those barrels standing and push for the fastest time to win! Beginners welcome. Everyone has to start somewhere!
The crowd looks on in awe as your brilliant display of Agility and Endurance proves you and your horse are true experts in Barrel Racing!

You're living your best barrel racing life with your Horse and have shown prowess that impresses the crowd. You may not have gotten the top prize, but you certainly had style and grace that will be the talk of the town.
You may not have gotten 1st Place, but you have shown you can stand toe to toe with the top contenders. The crowd cheers you on as you and your Horse stand proud to accept the award.
Keep those barrels standing and push for the fastest time to win! Prove you deserve to compete against the best of the best.

Congratulations! The competition was fierce, but you and your Horse were a force to be reckoned with. The barrels stayed perfectly still as your duo navigated the clover figuration gracefully and quickly. Looks like you're ready to compete with the experts!

Slow and steady wins the race! 3rd place that is. You weren't as quick as some of the other competitors, but your delicate touch and collaboration with your Horse made for an impressive showing, nonetheless.

Those barrels wobbled but they didn't fall down and that makes for a respectable 2nd Place! You and your Horse stand proudly while the crowd cheers the impressive competitors. With more practice, you'll be able to close the gap and take that 1st place with ease!
Keep those barrels standing and push for the fastest time to win! The competition is heating up! Don't let those barrels roll!

Congratulations! This impressive feat is the fruit of your hard work with your horse. Agility, Endurance, and a strong relationship between Horse and Rider have crowned you 1st place in the Master Bracket! All other riders look to you in admiration as you and your Horse stand proud and bask in your hard-earned victory.

It was a tough fight, but you managed to take 3rd in this competition of Master Barrel Racers! Your impressive entry has the crowd excitedly cheering you and your Horse on as you accept the recognition. It didn't happen this time, but no one can deny you and your Horse's potential to be champions!

You may have come in 2nd Place, but that is challenging! The competition comprises powerhouse talents, and you stood your ground amongst them. The applause continues as you wave toward the excited crowd, your Horse standing proudly at your side. Maybe next time you'll take it all!
Keep those barrels standing and push for the fastest time to win! The ultimate test of agility and endurance!

All those hours of training have paid off as you take the 1st Place position in the Beginner Endurance Race! You've set the pace and have nowhere to go but up from here! Your Horse gives an appreciative whinny as they're crowned the Beginners Bracket winner.

What an impressive showing for a beginner! You are taking steps towards those greater difficulties, and the hard work is showing in each of your races. This one had the entire crowd cheering your names and has put your name out there as someone to keep an eye on. You're going Places and the Hay Now! Equestrian Center is eagerly awaiting!
You nearly made it to 1st, but 2nd Place is still an impressive accomplishment! All eyes are on you and your Horse and the incredible potential you have shown today.
A long-distance race that showcases stamina and discipline as Horses compete for the fastest time. It's a long road ahead, but your Horse is up to the challenge!

Hay Now! Equestrian Center showcases the cream of the crop and now you're ranked among them! You've earned the respect of the onlookers as well as your fellow competitors. You and your Horse deserve a rewarding Nectar drink and feeder full of fresh Prairie Grass Hay for this victory and all the hard work!

Your push towards the top spot has been tough, but you've made it clear you belong in the Expert bracket! You can't help but smile as you hear your Horse's name chanted by the crowd. You and your Horse just need a little more practice and consistency to seize 1st Place glory!

You stand proudly next to your Horse, who nuzzles you appreciatively as you accept your award. No one can deny the partnership you have with your equine friend. It doesn't matter how far you have to run. You're on your way and can go the distance toward 1st Place!
A long-distance race that showcases stamina and discipline as Horses compete for the fastest time. Close the distance between you and that first place prize!

The Intermediate Bracket has some great up-and-comers; you have shown you are too! Your Horse deserves an extra treat for how hard they have worked! Your prowess shines through, and you're ready to keep moving up the ranks and show you are a champion!

Getting the top spot will take a bit more training, but 3rd place is nothing to whinny at. You feel a sense of pride and accomplishment in your Horse and are eager to keep improving and fine-tuning your skill set. Great work!

The climb to 1st Place isn't always easy, but you're almost there! With an amiable snort, your horse stands proud and basks in the win alongside you. Keep this up, and you'll be a decorated champion as faster than you can say, "Yee Haw!"
A long-distance race that showcases stamina and discipline as Horses compete for the fastest time. Shave down those seconds and push past the competition.

Fast and steady, you have earned your place with the Master Difficulty contenders. You pat your Horse, and it responds with a triumphant whinny. You and your Horse stand as champions after a dazzling display of cooperation and ability to endure even the most challenging races.

You and your horse put in the time and effort to win 3rd Place in the Master Bracket! This was an immense undertaking that you and your Horse handled with a deftness that leaves the crowd cheering your name. You may not have gotten 1st Place, but you're on the right track!

The crowd erupts into cheers for you and your Horse as you are awarded 2nd Place in the Master Bracket. Hold your head high and stand proud of the impressive showing you've brought to the competition today. Enjoy the win and get ready for the push to be number one.
A long-distance race that showcases stamina and discipline as Horses compete for the fastest time. Compete against the best and go the distance.

Well done! Despite being newbies to the Show Jumping scene, you outclassed the competition and are given the Beginners Division's 1st Place prize! Now to cultivate those skills and get ready for those tougher divisions!

It wasn't as polished as the rest of the participants, but still a noble effort! A few combination jumps caught you and your Horse off guard, so the judges docked points. It looks like it's time for a dramatic training montage!

You and your Horse have shown great potential and have taken the 2nd Place spot from the competition. It won't be long before you're able to beat out the rest of the Division for that 1st Place position.
Demonstrate your Horse's agility by navigating the Horse Jumps without dropping a bar and aim for the quickest time. A low bar is set, but is your Horse up to the challenge?
You and your Horse took to new heights in a fantastic display of showmanship and finesse, seizing the 1st Place prize! It won't be long until you reach the Ultimate Horse Championship!

You didn't take the top spot (or the second), but your jumping prowess has the entire Equestrian Center cheering in loud applause. This is just the thing you need to stay motivated to move up the ranks!
Today's brilliant showing cinched 2nd Place in the Show Jumping competition! You and your Horse wowed the crowd and have come one step closer to 1st Place!
Demonstrate your Horse's agility by navigating the Horse Jumps without dropping a bar and aim for the quickest time. Reach new heights and leap past the competition as an expert in Show Jumping.
As the competition intensified, you and your Horse took the challenge head-on and competed like champs! It's time to move up the ranks and face even more formidable competitors.

Wonderfully done! You and your Horse have snagged the 3rd Place spot in the Intermediate Division for Show Jumping. Those combinations were tricky, but your Horse navigated them deftly enough to please the crowd.

So close to being first! Still, 2nd Place is nothing to neigh at! You and your Horse should be proud of how you performed against the formidable opponents you faced. You're one hop, skip, and a jump away from taking that Intermediate 1st Place prize!
Demonstrate your Horse's agility by navigating the Horse Jumps without dropping a bar and aim for the quickest time. Leap into the next level and compete against the up-and-coming competitors.
Your Horse took every jump with ease and kept calm under pressure like a true pro. No obstacle stood in your way as you soared above the competition to take the top spot! Congratulations!
The hard work is paying off as you and your Horse take a commendable 3rd Place in the Master Division for Show Jumping! Keep practicing -- 1st Place is within reach!
2nd Place is a commendable feat that puts a spring in your step. The staunch competition will require a bit more work to surpass the heights of the other riders, but well done overall!

Demonstrate your Horse's agility by navigating the Horse Jumps without dropping a bar and aim for the quickest time. Prove your mastery and show there isn't an obstacle high enough to keep you from getting that prize.

Congratulations! You have earned the title of Ultimate Champion! This achievement is a testament to your hard work, talent, and stellar relationship with your Horse. You stand proudly in front of the cheering crowd knowing that you and your Horse will go down in history as one of the greats!

In a competition of the best of the best, you've powered through and secured 3rd Place. You and your Horse receive nods of respect and shouts of encouragement from the crowd. It wasn't a complete victory, but another try for that Ultimate title could be in your future!
While you weren't Ultimate Horse Champion this time, 2nd Place is a tremendous achievement! You competed against the greatest and you have proven yourself to be one of the stars!

Face the most formidable contenders in the ultimate test of equestrian prowess!

A relaxed Horse is a winning Horse! Your gentle touch and finesse bested the competition in the Beginner Division! No one can deny the excellent teamwork between you and your Horse. Time to pony up for the next level!
Your Horse was a little tense, but your performance was enough to earn you 3rd Place. With a little more trust and work on those fine details, you'll be able to move up the ranks with ease!

You and your Horse displayed impressive technique and trusted in each other while snagging 2nd Place! The crowd cheers loudly to celebrate and encourages you to keep up the good work! You show great potential!
Show off your Horse's best calm and collected gait in this test of disposition and trust. Calm those beginners' nerves and aim for a smooth ride.

Your elegant display of the partnership between Horse and rider has cinched 1st Place, beating out the rest of the Expert competitors! Folks left the Hay Now! Equestrian Center raving about how cool and collected you and your Horse looked. All that work on the fine details paid off!

While your Horse kept a calm disposition, you weren't able to pull off all the quick responses or seamless transitions required for 1st Place. Despite this, the crowd applauds you and your Horse for being one of the best in the show!
Show off your Horse's best calm and collected gait in this test of disposition and trust. An expert display of the bonds between Horse and Rider.

Show off your Horse's best calm and collected gait in this test of disposition and trust. Step up your Horse Riding Skills and prove you're no newbie.

Your Horse demonstrated superb grace and calm responsiveness to earn the coveted position of 1st Place! Nothing stands in your way now! All competitors look on with respect and admiration for you as the triumphant winner of the Western Pleasure Master Division!

You were able to show off your Horse's gentle temperament, but a few missteps caught you off-guard. Those little details make all the difference! With a little more training, you and your Horse can move up the ranks with a calm and collected gait!

2nd Place goes to you and your Horse! It was a close competition with just a few details edging out your performance. This was a fabulous demonstration that will only get better with practice. Next time, you'll be even more prepared!

They are better at using Horse Jumps, completing certain Community Jobs, and performing in the Show Jumping, Endurance Racing, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nA Horse's Jumping Skill is built by training with a Horse Jump but it can also be gained by sending a Horse for training using the Community Board.

Congratulations! Horse experts all around would agree that {0.SimFirstName} has the perfect Temperament. {0.SimFirstName} is very easy to get along with and is the perfect Horse for training Sims with low Horse Riding Skill to ride horses. What a gentle creature!\n\nThe Iron Works Signage: Temperament object is now available for purchase in Build Mode under the Wall Decorations section. It sure would look great on a Ranch Sign.

Congratulations! Horse experts all around would agree that {0.SimFirstName} has the perfect Temperament. Socializing with Sims and other Horses now is very likely to go well. When {0.SimFirstName} grows up, riding {0.SimPronounObjective} will be much easier without the fear of bucking.\n\nThe Iron Works Signage: Temperament sign is available for purchase in Build Mode under the Wall Decorations section. It sure would look great on a Ranch Sign.
Socializations with Sims and other Horses are now even more likely to succeed with {0.SimFirstName}.

Sims will now be able to Ask about Dealing with Sims with {0.SimFirstName}, which will improve the Sim's Charisma Skill gain for a time. Also, {0.SimFirstName} is even less likely to buck when being ridden.

Sims now will be able to Ask about Dealing with Sims with {0.SimFirstName}, which will improve the Sim's Charisma Skill development for a while.\n\nWhen {0.SimFirstName} grows up, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will be less likely to buck when ridden.
Sims will now be able to Discuss Secret Lives of Animals with {0.SimFirstName}.
Sims will now be able to Rub Neck, Scratch Neck, and Talk about Social Life with {0.SimFirstName}. Also, socializations with Sims and other Horses will be more likely to succeed.
Sims will now be able to give {0.SimFirstName} a Hug and Discuss Secret Lives of Animals with {0.SimFirstName}.
Sims will now be able to Talk about Social Life with {0.SimFirstName}. Also, socializations with Sims and other Horses are even more likely to succeed with {0.SimFirstName}.

{0.SimFirstName}'s new Skill in Temperament will begin to help {0.SimPronounObjective} successfully socialize with Sims and other Horses. As this Skill increases, socialization will become even more successful. Horses with high Temperament Skill are less likely to buck riders and will perform better at certain Community Jobs and the Western Pleasure, Show Jumping, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nTo track Horse Skill progress, select "Open Profile" on {0.SimFirstName} in the Relationships Panel.

{0.SimFirstName}'s new Skill in Temperament will begin to help {0.SimPronounObjective} socialize with Sims and other Horses. As this Skill increases, socialization will become even easier. Full-grown Horses with high Temperament Skill are less likely to buck riders and will perform better at certain Community Jobs and the Western Pleasure, Show Jumping, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nTo track Horse Skill progress, select "Open Profile" on {0.SimFirstName} in the Relationships Panel.

Sims will now be able to Ask about Controlling Temper with {0.SimFirstName}, which will help them recover from being Angry more quickly. Also, {0.SimFirstName} is less likely to buck when being ridden.

Sims will now be able to Hand Feed {0.SimFirstName}, and {0.SimFirstName} will be able to eat from an Animal Feeder or Prairie Grass on their own. Also, Sims are able to Ask about Controlling Temper with {0.SimFirstName}, which will help them recover from being Angry more quickly.\n\nWhen {0.SimFirstName} grows up, {0.SimPronounSubjective} will be less likely to buck when being ridden.

{0.SimFirstName} has reached a high enough Temperament Skill that {0.SimPronounSubjective} will no longer ever buck a rider. This will make {0.SimPronounObjective} a great Horse for training new riders!
Sims will now be able to Compliment Temperament on {0.SimFirstName}. Also, socializations with Sims and other Horses are now even more likely to succeed with {0.SimFirstName}.
Sims will now be able to Seek Emotional Support with {0.SimFirstName}, which will help them recover from being Sad more quickly.

Horses with high Temperament Skill buck less often when being ridden and get along more easily with Sims and other Horses. They also perform better at certain Community Jobs and the Western Pleasure, Show Jumping, and Ultimate Horse Championship competitions.\n\nA Horse's Temperament Skill is built when a Sim cares for and socializes with that Horse. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Community Board.
{4.String}: A rescue Horse found a home with the {3.String} household.
{4.String}: The {3.String} household recently rescued a Horse.
This ground has been muddied, dried, and trampled by more hooves and cloven-feet than it can count.
This soil never saw a drop of water, just the blazing sun by day and the cold wind by night.
Tall grass that's grown wild and free out on the prairie, nourished by nearby water.
Tall grass that grown wild and free out on the prairie, burned up by the high noon sun.
Horse Riding can be an activity for enjoyment, a means of travel, or a tool for winning Horse Competitions. However it's used, one thing is for sure: it requires a Horse.
Nectar Making combines the subtle art of extracting essential flavors from a wide variety of ingredients with the not-so-subtle art of smashing those ingredients to a pulp. Time to get stomping!
What a massive creature! One wrong move and everything could go wrong. {0.SimFirstName} won't be able to interact with horses until {0.SimPronounSubjective} Confronts the Fear.
A champion through and through! This Horse's Foals will gain Skills and that fighting spirit faster and have higher value.
Horses with Champion Genes have winner’s blood coursing through their veins! As a result, these horses will gain skills faster and hold a higher Simoleon value than the average horse.
These Horses love playing with toys and other Sims!
These horses are born to run! They can train for long periods of time without getting fatigued, and work up a horse-sized appetite.
(From aging up with Level 6 Temperament Skill)
Win competitions at the Hay Now! Equestrian Center in New Appaloosa.
These Horses are cranky! They act meaner towards other Sims and are more difficult to train.
These Horses tend to be stout of heart, unphazed by bad weather or danger. They also have a higher chance of succeeding when using Horse Jumps and Barrels.
These Horses are naturally more curious and enjoy exploring objects and using Horse Jumps and Barrels.
These Horses tend to be more ornery when it comes to training and will develop skills more slowly. They also have a higher likelihood of failing Horse Jumps and Barrels.
These Horses are full of energy! They gain athletic skills faster but are slower to gain the Temperament Skill.
These horses are scared of everything and will often become spooked. Due to their fearful nature, it will take them longer to gain Temperament Skill.
These Horses thrive in the open outdoors and will become sad if left inside for too long.
These Horses love all things social! They are more likely to have positive social interactions.
These Horses are content on their own and don't need as much attention.
These Horses are all-around rapid learners, giving them an increased gain of all skills. As an added bonus, they're also brilliant conversationalists!
These horses prefer relaxing over everything else! Because of their laid-back nature, they are quick to gain the Temperament skill and slow to gain athletic skills.
These Horses need social interaction often. They will frequently approach Sims in the hopes of getting their attention.
{0.SimFirstName} got a good head start on Temperament skill as a Foal, {0.SimPronounSubjective} is primed to learn more skills.
These Sims share a strong bond with Horses. They have an easier time socializing with and caring for Horses than other Sims.

These Sims train Horse Skills faster, sell Horses for higher prices, have more confidence when riding and training, and almost always have a good time when riding. In fact, they are so good with Horses that even Horses have more fun when being ridden by them! They also can Give Competition Advice to aspiring riders.
These Sims can craft pre-aged Nectar, have an iron bladder when it comes to drinking Nectar, and their negative emotions have less influence on their current mood.
(From Completing the Expert Nectar Maker Aspiration)
These Sims excel at ranch life and take pride in their work. They enjoy ranch chores and caring for their Livestock.

Are you an outdoorsy, animal-lovin', go-getter, fixin' to put down roots in a place that will support your dreams? Livin' the ranch life at Chestnut Ridge might just be what you've been dreaming of!

First take a moment to breathe in the fresh country air - there's nothin' quite like it.

Ready to welcome a Horse (or many?) into your home? You can adopt a young Foal and raise it with love and care, or if you're ready for riding, you can welcome an adult Horse too!

The local ranching community welcomes you with open arms and are ready to help folks of all experience levels, whether you're looking to mount up and ride for the first time or you're ready to bring home the gold at our Equestrian Center competitions.

Maybe you'd prefer to start off small (pun intended) with some Mini Goats and Mini Sheep - both adorable as all get-out!

The lush soil is ideal for exercising that green thumb of yours and growing the freshest, sweetest fruits and veggies. You might even try your hand at turning your yield into delicious Nectar and, who knows, you may even make a few (or a lot!) of Simoleons by selling a few bottles!

Cute Foals are not the only perk to Breeding Horses. Foals can earn Breedable Traits that are given just through Breeding. If one of the Foals' parents is a Championship Horse, there is a chance the Foal may receive this Trait only through Breeding. There are other Traits such as Curious, Playful, and Hardy that can only be earned through Breeding.
The time has come for your Sim's Mare to have a Foal! Hold your Horses, no need for panic! Your Sim can have a special moment with their Horse during Labor by choosing to Soothe Horse in Labor.

Horses will need to have a Friendly Relationship to Breed. Although Sims Encourage Breeding to happen between two Horses, the Horses can refuse if there is no positive relationship! The Horses can also refuse if they don't have a high enough Relationship with the Sim who is Encouraging to Breed.\n\nSims will need to be sure to Encourage Socialization between the two Horses that you have interest in Breeding. If Horses are on the same lot, they may also Socialize with each other on their own. Horses will always need to be on the same lot to Socialize with one another.

Which Horses can breed? Sims can breed Adult Stallions or Elder Stallions with Adult Mares. Elder Mares are not able to breed.\n\nFind a Horse's sex and age by hovering over the Horse or opening the Horse's Profile. To do the latter, select the Horse in the world and go to More Options, Actions, and then Open Profile. For a Horse who is not nearby, you can access the Profile from the Relationship Panel.

Sims can Breed their Horses and welcome adorable Foals to the Household!\n\nSims must be able to Encourage a Friendly relationship between a Stallion and a Mare that may result in the Mare becoming pregnant with a Foal.

Congratulations! You have a Pregnant Mare that will give birth to a Foal.

Keep in mind that while the Mare is Pregnant, she will not be able to be Mounted, Ridden, or be Bred till after the Foal is born.
Your Mare will also tire more easily and require a bit more Hay to keep her Hunger satisfied since she's eating for two!

If you're having some trouble getting two Horses to Breed, be sure that the two Horses are on the same lot at the time your Sim will Encourage to Breed. Make sure the Horses are both awake and within the age requirements with a Friendly Relationship. It's good to make sure your Horse has their Needs taken care of and they are not uncomfortable. Horses that are already Pregnant will not be able to Breed again till after the Foal is born. If a Breeding attempt fails, the Horses may need some time to do their own thing before Breeding again. Horses will not be able to Breed if there is a Sim Riding them! Let's try to give them needed privacy and Dismount the Horses first.
Spending time with Horses is fun for both, but for the ultimate in solo entertainment, try a Horse Toy! Buy a Hay Now! One Big Ball from Build Mode so your Horses can have fun on their own!

While Horses don't require a Bed to sleep, they sure do like it! Assigning Horses to Beds will ensure that they have a place just for them. This is a great way to make designated stalls on your ranch for each of your Horses.

Yes, Horses have to go too! You can pick up your Horses Manure and use it as Fertilizer, but be sure to pay attention to the quality of the Manure. A happy Horse will produce an Outstanding Quality Manure that's excellent for fertilizing while a Horse with low Socialization or discomfort will have a Poor Quality Manure.\n\nIf you want to reap the natural Rancher benefits of Manure, try to make sure your Horse's needs are in excellent condition. You will be able to check the Quality once you pick up the Manure by selecting Put in Inventory and the bag is placed in your Sim's Inventory.

To keep your Ranch Animals fed, pick up a Hay Now! Animal Feeder in Build Mode. Refilling the Animal Feeder costs a bit of Simoleons. Alternatively, refill it with harvested Prairie Grass Hay, which will reduce Fatigue for Horses that eat it! The Feeder holds enough for several meals. If your Sims don't have time, hire a Ranch Hand to take care of it (and more!).

Socializing with your horse is a good way to get to know them better. Socializing is a need that Horses have just like Sims do! Horses come with all sorts of personalities that make some social interactions easier with some horses than others.\n\nAn Aggressive Horse might react negatively more often to Sims and Horses Socializing with them, but don't give up! Give some Horses time and Socialize more with them by using the Talk To interaction or trying a Horse Care interaction such as Brush Coat.

Any good rancher knows that some cold water is the best way to help a Fatigued Horse after a day of training. Get a Water Trough! Your Livestock might also enjoy lapping up the leftover puddles.\n\nThe Hay Now! Horse Water Trough can be found in Build Mode in the Animals section of the Outdoors Category.

Each Horse can be Purchased for §1,000 or Rescued for §250. Due to the environment they came from, rescue Horses will have more difficult Traits, and extra attention and care may be needed.\n\nTo Purchase or Rescue a Horse visit the Phone's Home menu and select Call Ranch Animal Exchange, go to a Computer's Household category, use the Ranch Community Board, or visit the Equestrian Center in Chestnut Ridge's New Appaloosa Neighborhood.

If you don't start off with a Horse in your Household right out of Create a Sim, there are a variety of ways to acquire a Horse! Two of the main ways are to Purchase or Rescue. You can also Breed Horses. To learn more about Breeding Horses visit the Horse Breeding Lesson.\n\nIt is also possible to Sell a Horse for Simoleons.

Horses can also be Sold for Simoleons. A Horse's value depends on their Skill Levels, past Competition Performance, quality of care, and age. If a Horse has Champion Genes this will also increase their value. Selling Horses is a great way to earn a healthy income... if you have quality Horses to back that ambition up.\n\nTo Sell a Horse visit the Phone's Home menu and select Call Ranch Animal Exchange, go to a Computer's Household category, use the Ranch Community Board, or visit the Equestrian Center in Chestnut Ridge's New Appaloosa Neighborhood.

Horse Riding can be an activity for enjoyment, a means of travel, or a tool for winning Horse Competitions. This Skill impacts the riding Sim's capabilities, rather than the Horse's.\n\nTip: To learn more about Horse Skills see the Horse Skills & Training Lesson.

The best way to learn the Horse Riding Skill is to mount up and get riding—whether out for a leisurely ride or actively training a Horse's Agility, Jumping, or Endurance Skills! Anytime a Sim is on a Horse and that Horse is moving, the Horse Riding Skill is improving!

With so many things to do in Chestnut Ridge, it helps to have one spot with all the information you need!\n\nEach neighborhood has a Ranch Community Board were you can
  • learn about the town and its residents
  • purchase Ranch Animals
  • hire a Ranch Hand to help you with your Ranch
  • pick up odd jobs around town
  • send your Horse to train and compete at the Equestrian Center
If you want a Community Board of your own for ultra convenient access, purchase one from the Outdoor Activities category in Build Mode and place it on your home lot!

A Sim with low Horse Riding Skill and a Horse with low Agility or Jumping Skill can Practice Barrels on Horse Barrels or Practice Basic Jumps on the Horse Jumps. This gives a small amount of Skill increase for Horses with a smaller amount of Fatigue. As a Sim improves their Horse Riding Skill they can also choose to Intensely Train. This increases the amount of Skill a Horse is gaining, but also will Fatigue them much faster. Horses who have higher Jumping or Agility score also have a more "advanced" option for training on these objects. They can Race Barrels or Practice Advanced Jumps, which does the same thing as Intensely Train. These options for improved training technique are great when an experienced Horse rider is trying to train an unskilled Horse or a more skilled Horse is being trained by a Sim who is new to Horse Riding.

A Horse's Jumping and Agility Skills can be trained on the Horse Barrels and Horse Jumps training objects. While riding a Horse during training, a Sim's Horse Riding Skill will also increase on these objects!\n\nTip: When training, a Horse may become Fatigued. At that point, it's probably best to give them a break and train more later!

Endurance Skill is all about how resilient a Horse is! A horse with high Skill in Endurance will become Fatigued less often, do better at certain Community Jobs and the Endurance Race, Show Jumping, and Ultimate Horse Championship Competitions.\n\nEndurance Skill is built by going for rides. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Ranch Community Board.

Horses have four unique Skills of their own that affect how they interact with Sims and how well they'll perform at Community Jobs and Horse Competitions. These Skills include: Temperament, Agility, Jumping, and Endurance. As these Skills improve, a Horse's value will increase, allowing Sims who specialize in Horse Training to make substantial Simoleons from training and selling Horses. You can view a Horse's Skill levels by selecting them in a Sim's Relationship Panel at the bottom right of the screen, then choosing "Open Profile."

Horses with high Jumping Skill love to reach for new heights! They are better at using Horse Jumps, completing certain Community Jobs, and performing in the Show Jumping, Endurance Racing, and Ultimate Horse Championship Competitions.\n\nA Horse's Jumping Skill is built by training with a Horse Jump, but it can also be gained by sending a Horse for training using the Ranch Community Board.

A Sim must be mounted on a Horse to start training with Horse Barrels or Horse Jumps. As Horse Riding Skill develops, a Sim can learn to Direct Horse to train on their own without a rider. This is a great way for Children to train Horses, since Horse Jumps and Horse Barrels are a little too dangerous for them!

Horse Jumps and Horse Barrels can be found in Build Mode in the Outdoor Category under Animals. There are four of these objects in total. For Horse Jumps there are the Heritage Vintage Horse Jumps and the Champ Certified Horse Jumps objects. For Horse Barrels there are the Heritage Vintage Horse Barrels and the Champ Certified Horse Barrels objects.\n\nBuild Mode isn't the only place to find these objects. They're also located in the open world in all of Chestnut Ridge's three Neighborhoods.

Horses with high Temperament Skill buck less often when being ridden and get along more easily with Sims and other Horses. They also perform better at certain Community Jobs and the Western Pleasure, Show Jumping, and Ultimate Horse Championship Competitions.\n\nA Horse's Temperament Skill is built when a Sim cares for and socializes with that Horse. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Ranch Community Board.

Agility Skill affects how quickly and easily a Horse can move! Horses with high Agility are better at using Horse Barrels, completing certain Community Jobs, and performing in the Barrel Racing, Western Pleasure, and Ultimate Horse Championship Competitions.\n\nA Horse's Agility Skill is built by training with Horse Barrels. Skill can also be acquired by sending a Horse for training using the Ranch Community Board.

Mini Goats and Mini Sheep are more than adorable ranch companions! Mini Sheep can be sheared and Mini Goats can be milked once per day. As you earn their trust, they even will help with the garden and improve negative Mood.

Life is precious and fleeting. Mini Goats and Mini Sheep will pass away from old age when the time comes. If you are not ready to part with your animal friends, go to the Game Options menu, select Gameplay, and turn off Animal Aging. Now you don't have to say goodbye!

If your Mini Goats and Mini Sheep are Unhappy for too long, they will run away to greener pastures. But don't worry! They'll give you a second chance and stay if you take better care of them.\n\nIf you are having trouble keeping up with them, hire a Ranch Hand to help out!

Mini Goats and Mini Sheep require care of their Hunger, Hygiene, and Attention to keep their Mood up. The happier they are, the more you can earn from shearing and milking.\n\nHover over an animal to see the status of Needs and other information such as their Happiness and life stage.

Hunger: To feed these Ranch Animals, purchase a Hay Now! Animal Feeder in Build Mode or bottle feed them yourself. While you're there, buy some Prairie Grass so they can graze on their own. Hygiene: Give them a good brushing to keep them clean. Attention: Mini Goats and Mini Sheep are social creatures, so have a chat or give them a nice pet. If you succeed, surrounding Mini Goats and Mini Sheep will take notice and get Attention, too!
But where can you find the Nectar Rack? The Rancher's Stackable Nectar Storage Rack can be found in Build Mode in the Hobbies & Skills or Misc Decorations categories.

How well-aged a Nectar is matters! The perfect way to age it more quickly and securely is to use a Nectar Rack! Store up to 13 bottles of Nectar in each Nectar Rack.\n\nYou can also age Nectar more quickly by storing it in a Basement. This will age it less quickly than a Nectar Rack, but more quickly than normal.

Do you want to get super organized with Nectar? We do! Name your Nectar Racks. Select a Nectar Rack and choose the Name interaction. You can call it whatever you want. As an example, "Trash Nectar Storage." Then you can keep all of your Trash Nectar in it and never confuse it with the obviously less tasty Strawberry Nectar you keep in that other Nectar Rack.
Stack'n back'em! Nectar Racks are stackable and can be placed side-to-side and back-to-back. Arrange them any way you want to build an awesome Nectar aging room!

When using a Nectar Rack: Once a Nectar is Finely Aged (the best aging it'll reach), the Grab a Finely Aged Nectar Bottle and Collect All Finely Aged Nectar Bottles interactions will become available on the object. These options will help you collect only the best and leave the rest of the Nectars in the Nectar Rack to age longer!

Different Nectars can be made by a variety of different Ingredients, but did you know that these different Nectars will have different effects on a Sim when drinking them? When you craft a new Nectar check out the Notebook next to the Sim's Phone on the bottom left of the screen. New information on each Nectar type is added here—or you can always wait to see what happens.\n\nJust be sure not to drink too much Nectar! Or do. There are consequences.

But what if you don't want to drink your Nectar? What if you're in it for the Simoleons? Various factors impact how much each bottle of Nectar can sell for. To increase the amount of Simoleons earned from each bottle consider the following: • Nectar price increases from Not Yet Aged, to Lightly Aged, to Moderately Aged, and peaks at Finely Aged. • Nectar price increases from Poor Quality to Normal Quality, and peaks at Excellent Quality. Try using high quality Ingredients to improve the quality of Nectar. • Nectars that require more Nectar Making Skill to craft are worth more. Improve Nectar Making Skill to craft more difficult Nectars. • The Mysterious Rancher will pay more money for Nectar than selling it regularly will.

Name your Nectar! This is particularly useful for a Nectar you're saving for a special date. "Lumberjackson Wedding Nectar," as an example. Or if you chose to make Fruit or Berry Nectar you could specify what type of Fruit or Berry you used on the bottle itself. You might end up with "Banana Nectar"!\n\nSimply select a bottle of Nectar and choose the Name interaction.

You can store, pour, or sell your Nectar. See the Nectar Aging & Nectar Rack Lesson to learn more about storing Nectar and we'll cover Selling later in this Lesson. For now, let's talk about serving Nectar.\n\nEach bottle of Nectar starts off corked and has four servings within it. When you choose to Pour 1, 2, 3, or 4 Servings from the bottle you'll uncork the bottle, opening it. At this point, it won't age further and it will have a limited time before it Spoils. Opening a bottle also drastically decreases the Nectar's sell value.

When Nectar is first crafted it is Not Yet Aged. If the bottle isn't opened, it'll age slowly over time becoming first Lightly Aged, then Moderately Aged, until it reaches its peak at Finely Aged. As a Nectar ages it increases in sale value.\n\nYou can hover over a Nectar Bottle to see how aged a bottle currently is in the Hovertip.

Some Sims (we're talking about you Snobs and Foodies) prefer to only drink the best Nectars, so what improves a Nectar's quality?\n\nCurrent Skill Level, Ingredient Quality, and the Skill Level required to craft a bottle of Nectar all impact the quality of each Nectar bottle. To increase the chance of crafting Excellent Nectar, try improving Nectar Making Skill, growing high quality plants for Ingredients, or making sure a Sim is in a good mood while they are crafting.

After you select what type of Nectar you want to craft, your Sim will get to work! While using a Nectar Maker your Sim will gain Nectar Making Skill. This Skill helps to improve the quality of your Nectar, the speed at which you use the Nectar Maker, and unlocks new Nectar types for you to craft!\n\nNectar bottles that have been fully crafted will be picked up by your Sim and put into their personal Inventory.

Before you can Craft Nectar, you're going to need Ingredients! Basic Ingredients can be purchased on the Nectar Maker itself or purchased at Chestnut Ridge's Bits & Bales Mercantile store in the New Appaloosa Neighborhood.\n\nThe best ingredients, however, are grown in gardens! Seeds can be purchased through Planter Boxes found in Build Mode or from a Computer. These purchased seeds will then be available in your Sim's inventory. Improving in Gardening Skill, taking care of your Plants, and planting better seeds from your Harvest will result in even better Ingredients that will make your Nectar the best it can be!

When you use the Nectar Maker as often as we do it tends to get dirty! You can tell because it will look grungy. A dirty Nectar Maker will impact the quality of your Nectar, so you certainly want to keep it clean. Select the Nectar Maker and choose Clean Nectar Maker to scrub away all the grime. Nobody wants to drink yucky, dirty Nectar!

How do you know what Ingredients you need? Select the Nectar Maker and choose Craft Nectar. The menu that appears will tell you what Ingredients are needed, what Nectars you can craft, and what Nectar Making Skill is needed to craft them! When you have the right Ingredients and the right Skill Level, the option to craft that particular Nectar type will become available.

The Nectar Maker object allows Sims to both level up their Nectar Making Skill and also craft delectable bottles of Nectar—in all its glorious varieties.\n\nTo get started, the Rootin' Fruit'n Nectar Maker can be purchased in Build Mode in the Hobbies & Skills or Outdoor Activities categories.

The Nectar Making Skill can be improved by crafting bottles at the Nectar Maker. Improving the Nectar Making Skill increases how quickly Sims can craft Nectar and unlocks access to new Nectar recipes.

Nectar Making combines the subtle art of extracting essential flavors from a wide variety of ingredients with the not-so-subtle art of smashing those ingredients to a pulp. The outcome? Bottles of Nectar that can be stored for a special occasion, poured for drinking, or sold for Simoleons!

Prairie Grass is an excellent grazing resource for Horses, Mini Goats, and Mini Sheep. Sims can guide Horses to search patches of it for goodies. When it grows tall enough, Sims can harvest it for Hay that goes into the Sim's Inventory. Sims then can stock Animal Feeders with the Hay or hand feed it to Ranch Animals.\n\nThe Wild Prairie Grass Lot Challenge enables Prairie Grass to sprout and spread on its own! Otherwise, you can place it from Build Mode.

Mini Goats and Mini Sheep are a perfect addition to any ranch!\n\nPurchase them from:
  • Phone's Home section: Call Ranch Animal Exchange
  • Ranch Community Board
  • Hay Now! Animal Feeder
  • Bits & Bales Mercantile in New Appaloosa

Want to show off your Ranch? Meet your neighbors? Try planning either a Ranch Animal Day or a Ranch Gathering event! At a Ranch Animal Day event, family, friends, and neighbors gather together to care for and play with Horses and Mini Animals. Talk about cuteness overload! Meanwhile, Ranch Gatherings are an event filled with good-natured, rowdy fun! There's Ranch Music, Cowpoke Dancing, Grilling, Nectar Making (and drinking), and all the socialization a Sim could dream up! To get started, select the Phone and choose Social then Plan a Social Event or go to the Calendar and choose Add Event. This menu can also be accessed from the Ranch Community Board. From there select Plan a Ranch Event.

Running a Ranch all by yourself can be hard! There's gardening, repairs, and animals to be tended to, and there's never a day off from the work. Animals don't take weekends off! Sometimes a single Sim can't handle it all! Hire a Ranch Hand!\n\nA Ranch Hand will come by every day to help out with the aforementioned work. They can garden, care for Horses and Livestock, and even repair broke down items on the lot. Most importantly they have the Skills to do the work well!

Some tasks will only be done if you ask the Ranch Hand to do them, and some can be requested more directly. When your Ranch Hand is on the lot, select them. In the Ranch Hand Pie Menu category choose Ask to. From there, you can ask them to Make a Repair or Water Plants, which they'll do more quickly than they might have otherwise.\n\nYou can also ask them to Collect Manure or Harvest Plants. They won't do this on their own otherwise. When you have them do these things, they'll collect the "harvest" and leave it for you in the Household Inventory in Build Mode. This will allow your Household to do what they'd like with these items.

So how do you get your very own Ranch Hand? Easy. Select the Phone at the bottom left of the screen and choose to Hire a Service in the Home category. Then choose Ranch Hand. You can only have one Ranch Hand at a time, and they will arrive every day from 7AM to 7PM. They're going to be helping out around the Ranch a lot!

What if you don't want your Ranch Hand to do all of that? Well, you can always Assign Chores. When your Ranch Hand arrives, select them. In the Ranch Hand Pie Menu category choose Assign Chores. From there, you can determine if you want them to focus on Gardening, Repairs, and/or Livestock and Horse Care. They start off doing all of these things, but after you adjust the assigned chores, they'll only do what you want going forward.

Hay Now! Equestrian Center in New Appaloosa is the premier location for everything related to Horses. Train up your trusty steed and test your Horse's Skills in five types of competitions: Barrel Racing, Endurance Racing, Show Jumping, Western Pleasure, or compete with the best of the best in the Ultimate Horse Championship.\n\nThe Equestrian Center is open from 7 AM to 7 PM every day.

Your ranch is an important part of this Chestnut Ridge, too! Establish your presence by naming your ranch and decorating your Ranch Sign. You can find these large entrance signs in Build Mode by searching for "Ranch Sign". They have a ton of spots to hang decorations such as metal animal signage (text search for "signage") and a variety of Wall Decorations. Experiment to find your own brand of ranch flair! Earn more signage by achieving the highest levels of a Sim's Horse Riding Skill and the Horse's four Skills: Temperament, Agility, Jumping, and Endurance! Once you have a Sign, select it to name your ranch. Happy ranching!

Preparing for a competition at the Hay Now! Equestrian Center? Duke's Hall can meet all the essential Horse Care needs so you and your steed can be in top form. New Appaloosa also is the hot spot for all the Ranchers and Nectar Makers when they finish a hard day's work. Head to The Rusty Horseshoe for a time of boisterous country dancing. Take a seat and savor a sip of Nectar at The Oak Barrel.

While in New Appaloosa, you can pick up supplies from Bits & Bales Mercantile, which has rotating inventory plus Nectar Making ingredients and even Mini Goats and Mini Sheep. At Chestnut Chaps, Sims can plan and change outfits to gussy up and ensure they look their best for their time in town. Outside of town for adventurous souls, Galloping Gulch is said to be home to the ominous Dreadhorse Caverns. Find it to discover what the mysterious cave contains....
Sims may add a rescued Horse to their household.

Lauded as one of the go-to regions for Horse Riding, the Gulch is chockfull of gorgeous trails and stunning outlooks. Explore the Gulch's wonders as you honor the noble Horses that have passed on at Steed's Rest, explore the perilous Dreadhorse Caverns, or enjoy time under the stars at Saddle Summit Campgrounds.

Watched over by the Trusty Steed Rock, known as "Ol' Biscuit" to the locals, Riders' Glen has been home to generations of Ranchers and Nectar Makers. With open space for Ranch Animals, ideal conditions for Nectar Making, and kind neighbors to boot, Riders' Glen is a welcome community for all walks of life.

The historic New Appaloosa serves as a hub for Horse Riders, Ranchers, and Nectar Makers. Whether competing at the Hay Now! Equestrian Center, enjoying a night out at the dance hall, or savoring Nectar with good friends, this old watering hole has something for everyone.
